entry.title: Quantum Cosmology
entry.summary: An elementary review of quantum cosmology. (Talk given at Texas/Pascos 1992 at Berkeley)

entry.title: Non-standard phase space variables, quantization, and path integrals, or little ado about much
entry.summary: Contribution to the Misner Festshrift, no abstract.

entry.title: A remark on kinks and time machines
entry.summary: We describe an elementary proof that a manifold with the topology of the Politzer time machine does not admit a nonsingular, asymptotically flat Lorentz metric.

entry.title: Quantum Particle As Seen In Light Scattering
entry.summary: A possible mathematical model has been proposed for motion of illuminated quantum particles seen by eyes or similar devices mapping the scattered light.

entry.title: Ricci Tensor of Diagonal Metric
entry.summary: Efficient formulae of Ricci tensor for an arbitrary diagonal metric are presented.

entry.title: Gravitational Wave Detector Sites
entry.summary: Locations and orientations of current and proposed laser-interferometric gravitational wave detectors are given in tabular form.

entry.title: Suggestions For Giving Talks
entry.summary: This is a latex'd version of Robert Geroch's 1973 notes entitled 'Suggestions For Giving Talks'.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages (no figures), Revtex, uses twocolumn.sty and header.sty (included)

entry.title: Diagonalization of pp-waves
entry.summary: A coordinate transformation is found which diagonalizes the axisymmetric pp-waves. Its effect upon concrete solutions, including impulsive and shock waves, is discussed.

entry.title: Post-Riemannian Spacetimes Admit a Causal Structure
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn due to conceptual mistakes. A corrected version will soon be available at the gr-qc archive.

entry.title: Black Holes
entry.summary: Lecture notes for a 'Part III' course 'Black Holes' given in DAMTP, Cambridge. The course covers some of the developments in Black Hole physics of the 1960s and 1970s.

entry.title: On the interpretation of relativistic spin networks and the balanced state sum
entry.summary: We discuss the interpretation of the state sum of Barrett and Crane.

entry.title: Relativistic hydrodynamic accretion onto a spherical black hole
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. A revised and expanded version is gr-qc/9907028 (Phys.Rev. D60 (1999) 104043).

entry.title: Summary of Session A6: Alternative Theories of Gravity
entry.summary: This is a summary of the workshop A.6 on Alternative Theories of Gravity, prepared for the proceedings for the GR15 conference.

entry.title: Asymptotic Isometry and Two Dimensional Anti-de Sitter Gravity
entry.summary: We analyze canonical asymptotic isometry of two dimensional AdS dilaton gravity in detail.

entry.title: Characteristic hypersurfaces in a relativistic superfluid theory
entry.summary: By discussing the Cauchy problem, we determine the covariant equation of the characteristic hypersurfaces in a relativistic superfluid theory.

entry.title: Large Scale Structures in the Universe
entry.summary: In this brief communication we show why superclusters would naturally arise in the universe.

entry.title: A geodesically complete space-time with a crushing null hypersurface
entry.summary: Withdrawn; conclusion that the singularity is strong is incorrect.

entry.title: A Simple Formula for Generating Chern Characters by Repeated Exterior Differentiation
entry.summary: A simple formula is given for generating Chern characters by repeated exterior differentiation for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

entry.title: A Sequence of Generalizations of Cartan's Conservation of Torsion Theorem
entry.summary: A sequence of generalizations of Cartan's conservation of torsion theorem is given for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

entry.title: Towards a regular type N vacuum gravitational field
entry.summary: An exact twisting type N vacuum solution is found. It has regular gauge and curvature invariants and decays to flat spacetime for big retarded times.

entry.title: Underlying Field Structure of Matter
entry.summary: Intrinsic unfication of quantum theory and general relativity based on the underlying quantum dynamics of fundamental field has been proposed.

entry.title: Quantum mechanical time contradicts the uncertainty principle
entry.summary: The a priori time in conventional quantum mechanics is shown to contradict the uncertainty principle. A possible solution is given.

entry.title: Relativistic Quantum Non-Locality
entry.summary: The controversy between relativistic causality and quantum non-locality can be resolved by establishing the general relativistic background of quantum non-locality.

entry.title: Notes on Riemann geometry and integrable systems. Part IV
entry.summary: The connection between multidimensional soliton equations and three-dimensional Riemann space is discussed.

entry.title: Notes on Riemann geometry and integrable systems. Part V
entry.summary: Some aspects of multidimensional soliton geometry are considered.

entry.title: Static black holes in scalar tensor gravity
entry.summary: We study static black hole solutions in scalar tensor gravity. We present exact solutions in hiperextended models with a quadratic scalar potential.

entry.title: Light propagation around a relativistic vortex flow of dielectric medium
entry.summary: We determine the path of the light around a dielectric vortex described by the relativistic vortex flow of a perfect fluid.

entry.title: On Hyperbolic "Theories" of Relativistic Dissipative Fluids
entry.summary: It is argued that, at least for the case of Navier-Stokes fluids, the so-called hyperbolic theories of dissipation are not viable.

entry.title: The Kretschmann scalar for 5D Vacua
entry.summary: We present a streamlined calculation of the Kretschmann scalar for 5D Vacua considered recently by Fukui et al. (gr-qc/0105112).

entry.title: The Newtonian limit of fourth-order gravity
entry.summary: The weak-field slow-motion limit of fourth-order gravity will be discussed.

entry.title: Report on A5. Computer Methods
entry.summary: Session A5 on numerical methods contained talks on colliding black holes, critical phenomena, investigation of singularities, and computer algebra.

entry.title: On geometry behind Birkhoff theorem
entry.summary: This is an elementary geometrical proof of Birkhoff theorem. It is hardly important, but the pictures behind are quite nice.

entry.title: Operadic curvature as a tool for gravity
entry.summary: The deformation equation and its integrability condition (Bianchi identity) of a non-associative deformation in operad algebra are found. Their relation to the theory of gravity is discussed.

entry.title: The number of tensor differential invariants of a Riemannian metric
entry.summary: We determine the number of functionally independent components of tensors involving higher-order derivatives of a Riemannian metric.

entry.title: Einstein's Equation in Pictures
entry.summary: This paper gives a self-contained, elementary, and largely pictorial statement of Einstein's equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages. Also available, with associated Mathematica code, at http://zaphod.uchicago.edu/~mfrank/GR/einpics.html

entry.title: Cosmic Force
entry.summary: The determination of the geodesics in Scharzschild black hole and de Sitter space.

entry.title: Brane Cosmology and Higher Derivative Theory
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045

entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045

entry.title: A New Type of Isotropic Cosmological Model
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045

entry.title: Brane and Nonisotropic Bianchi Cosmology
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045

entry.title: Brane in the Relativistic Theory of Gravitation
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: Regge-Teitelboim Goedetic Brane Gravity and Effective Cosmology
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: A new phenomenological approach to the Universe expansion
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: Eppur, si muove !
entry.summary: Simple ideas that shed new light on the physics of rotation as it concerns two famous experiments: The Wilson and Wilson, and the Michelson and Morley experiments.

entry.title: On the Lorentz Invariant Gravitation Field Theory
entry.summary: The theory of gravitation field within the special theory of relativity is analyzed.

entry.title: Time machine (1988--2001)
entry.summary: A very brief and popular account of the time machine problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at 11th UK Conference on the Philosophy of Physics (Oxford 2002)

entry.title: Introduction to Bosonic String Theory
entry.summary: Introductory Notes in Bosonic String Theory and its Canonical Quantization.
entry.arxiv:comment: 39 pages, No figures. First Published in Journal Of Theoretics

entry.title: Cosmology with primordial black holes
entry.summary: Some aspects of Cosmology with primordial black holes are briefly reviewed

entry.title: Relativity in rotating frames
entry.summary: A common error, originally due to Ehrenfest, is corrected.

entry.title: Binding energy of static perfect fluids
entry.summary: Corrected misprints and omissions.

entry.title: Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: General lectures on quantum gravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lectures given at Karpacz. 40 pages, submitted to Lecture Notes in Physics. Bigger figures

entry.title: Gravity and the quantum potential
entry.summary: We review some material connecting gravity and the quantum potential and provide a few new observations.

entry.title: Lectures on Mathematical Cosmology
entry.summary: We present mathematical details of several cosmological models, whereby the topological and the geometrical background will be emphasized.

entry.title: Minisuperspace Approach of Generalized Gravitational Models
entry.summary: Motivated by the dark energy issue, the minisuperspace approach for general relativistic cosmological theories is outlined.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTex, to appear in QG issue of TSPU Vestnik

entry.title: Differential Invariants for Higher-Rank Tensors. A Progress Report
entry.summary: We outline the construction of differential invariants for higher--rank tensors.

entry.title: Dark energy and quantum entanglement
entry.summary: Entangled states in the universe may change interpretation of observations and even revise the concept of dark energy.

entry.title: Stationary Black Holes
entry.summary: We review the theory of stationary black hole solutions of vacuum Einstein equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 2 figures, to appear in Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics in 2006

entry.title: Electrovac $pp$-waves
entry.summary: New exact solutions of the Einstein-Maxwell field equations that describe $pp$-waves are presented.

entry.title: Rebuttal to a Paper on Wormholes
entry.summary: In a recent paper on wormholes (gr-qc/0503097), the author of that paper demonstrated that he didn't know what he was talking about. In this paper I correct the author's naive erroneous misconceptions.

entry.title: On the Riemann extension of rotating Mikowsky space-time metric
entry.summary: Some properties of eight-dimensional Riemann extension of Minkowsky space-time metric in rotating coordinate system are studied.

entry.title: Particle Creation in de Sitter Space and Time Quantization
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Quantization of Physical Models and Non-Commutative Geometry
entry.summary: Application of the noncommutative geometry to several physical models is considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk presented at Workshop on High Energy Physics&Field Theory (Protvino, Russia, 2004)

entry.title: Einstein, Hilbert and Equations of Gravitation
entry.summary: Some highlights of the priority in the discovery of the gravitational field equations are given.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk presented at Workshop on High Energy Physics&Field Theory (Protvino, Russia, 2004)

entry.title: XXVII International Workshop on High Energy Physics and Field Theory
entry.summary: BLACK HOLES ON EARTH AND IN SPACE

entry.title: Weyl Invariant Dynamics in 3 Dimensions
entry.summary: We analyze a variety of Weyl invariant dynamical problems in three dimensions.

entry.title: Null energy in plane Kaluza-Klein worlds
entry.summary: We study the energy problem in the $R0X$ spacetimes in 5D. We found that for the Einstein, Landau-Lifschitz and the Moller complexes are null.

entry.title: On the Riemann Extension of the Gödel Space-Time metric
entry.summary: Some properties of the G\"odel space-time metric and its Riemann extension are studied

entry.title: New Description of Self-Dual Metrics
entry.summary: We show that Pleba\'nski's equation for self-dual metrics is equivalent to a pair of equations describing canonical transformations in 2-dimensional phase spaces. Examples of linearizations of these equations are given.

entry.title: A Note on Black Hole Temperature and Entropy
entry.summary: We propose intuitive derivations of the Hawking temperature and the Bekenstein-Hawking entropy of a Schwarzschild black hole.

entry.title: On a Possible Indicator of Homogeneity of the Universe
entry.summary: A new method is described for recognising internal non-randomness in deep galaxy surveys.

entry.title: The spherical symmetry of static stellar systems in general relativity
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn. Error lemma 7.

entry.title: A Comment on hep-th/0608078
entry.summary: The above hep-th posting purports -- erroneously -- to be a comment on a Note by me in gr-qc.

entry.title: On solutions of a Heavenly equations and their generalizations
entry.summary: Some solutions of the Heavenly equations and their generalizations are considered

entry.title: Dark Matter as a Consequence of Nonseparable Lagrangian
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Specialized computer algebra system for application in general relativity
entry.summary: A brief characteristic of the specialized computer algebra system GRG_EC intended for symbolic computations in the field of general relativity is given.

entry.title: Gravitomagnetism, Frame-Dragging and Lunar Laser Ranging
entry.summary: We discuss here the measurement of gravitomagnetism and frame dragging with Lunar Laser Ranging, LAGEOS and LARES Satellites, and Gravity Probe B.

entry.title: On the harmonic map equation
entry.summary: A generalized harmonic map equation is presented based on the proposed action functional in the Weyl space (PLA, 135, 315, 1989).

entry.title: Twisting type N vacuums with cosmological constant
entry.summary: We provide the first examples of vacuum metrics with cosmological constant which have a twisting quadruple principal null direction.

entry.title: Conservation laws for a general Lorentz connection
entry.summary: We derive conservation laws for energy-momentum (canonical and dynamical) and angular momentum for a general Lorentz connection.

entry.title: Evaluation of new spin foam vertex amplitudes with boundary states
entry.summary: Merged into arXiv:0809.3190.

entry.title: A Relativistic Particle and Gravitoelectromagnetism
entry.summary: The mutual interaction of a relativistic particle and gravitoelectromagnetism (GEM) is studied both classically and quantum theoretically.

entry.title: Ashtekar's variables without spin
entry.summary: Ashtekar's variables are shown to arise naturally from a 3+1 split of general relativity in the Einstein-Cartan formulation. Thereby spinors are exorcised.

entry.title: Reply to `A comment on `The Cauchy problem of f(R) gravity''
entry.summary: We reply to a comment by Capozziello and Vignolo about the Cauchy problem of Palatini f(R) gravity.

entry.title: Faster Than Light?
entry.summary: It is argued that special relativity remains a viable physical theory even when there is permitted signals traveling faster than light.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages; submitted to J. Lorentz Geometry

entry.title: On some toy quantum cosmology
entry.summary: Some connections of the quantum potential to gravitation are discussed.

entry.title: Positive Gravitattional Energy in Arbitrary Dimensions
entry.summary: We present a streamlined, complete proof, valid in arbitrary space dimension $n$, and using only spinors on the oriented Riemannian space $(M^{n};g),$ of the positive energy theorem in General Relativity.

entry.title: Bertotti-Robinson and Melvin Spacetimes
entry.summary: Similarities between the Melvin and Bertotti-Robinson spacetimes are discussed and a uniqueness conjecture is formulated.

entry.title: Thermodynamics and scale relativity
entry.summary: It is shown how the fractal paths of scale relativity (following Nottale) can be introduced into a thermodynamical context (following Asadov-Kechkin).

entry.title: Introduction to Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: In this talk, we give a glimpse of the problems with quantum gravity and some possible solutions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk held at UNESP, Guaratingueta, 11/23/2011

entry.title: The relativistic precession of the orbits
entry.summary: The relativistic precession can be quickly inferred from the nonlinear polar orbit equation without actually solving it.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted for publication in Astrophysics & Space Science

entry.title: Birkhoff's theorem and perturbations in $f(R)$ theories
entry.summary: Invited contribution to Annalen der Physik (Expert Opinion).

entry.title: Matters of Gravity, The Newsletter of the Topical Group on Gravitation of the American Physical Society, Volume 41, Winter 2013
entry.summary: GGR News: we hear that... 100 years ago GGR program at the APS meeting in Denver, CO

entry.title: A characterization of causal automorphisms on two-dimensional Minkowski spacetime
entry.summary: It is shown that causal automorphisms on two-dimensional Minkowski spacetime can be characterized by the invariance of the wave equations.

entry.title: Hidden Lorentz symmetry of the Horava - Lifshitz gravity
entry.summary: In this letter it is shown that the Horava-Lifshitz gravity theory admits Lorentz symmetry preserving preferred global time foliation of the spacetime.

entry.title: Geometric Asymptotics and Beyond
entry.summary: We discuss some global and semi-global existence and stability results obtained with the use of the conformal field equations.

entry.title: Hamiltonian analysis of self-dual gauge gravity
entry.summary: The Hamiltonian analysis of the self-dual gauge gravity theory is carried out. The resulting canonical structure is equivalent to that of self-dual gravity.

entry.title: On the Supergravitational Solitons
entry.summary: The extention of the integrable ansatz of pure Einstein gravity to supergravity is completed. The procedure of construction the exact supergravitational solitonic solutions is described.

entry.title: Matters of Gravity, The Newsletter of the Topical Group on Gravitation of the American Physical Society, Volume 45, June 2015
entry.summary: GGR News: We Hear That ... Advanced LIGO in mid-2015 GGR dominates April APS meeting Conference Reports: GaryFest

entry.title: Lie Group Cosmology
entry.summary: Our universe is a deforming Lie group.

entry.title: Aspects of quantum chaos inside Black Holes
entry.summary: We will argument how infalling information can be chaotized inside realistic quantum black holes.
entry.arxiv:comment: prepared for the proceeding of "Karl Schwarzschild meeting 2015"

entry.title: Mathematical Models in Isotropic Cosmology
entry.summary: An axiomatic approach to the mathematical models of the isotropic cosmology.

entry.title: Cosmology of a Heisenberg fluid
entry.summary: We consider a scenario in which the global geometry of the universe is driven by non-linear fermions obeying Heisenberg dynamics.

entry.title: Introduzione alla Cosmologia
entry.summary: Introductory lectures notes on cosmology, aimed at master students in physics and based on a course held at Milano University (in Italian).

entry.title: Non-singular spinors in gravity with propagating torsion
entry.summary: We demonstrate that when the propagating torsion massive axial vector is coupled to spinor fields then gravitational singularities do not form necessarily.

entry.title: Lectures on gravitation
entry.summary: Lecture notes on selected topics in the theory of gravitation.

entry.title: Parametric equations of the expansion of a closed universe with torsion
entry.summary: Using the Friedmann equations for a closed universe with spin and torsion, parametric equations for the scale factor and time are derived for the early universe.

entry.title: Relativistic Newtonian gravitation
entry.summary: Newton + EP + local SR imply all the GR results for central symmetric static gravitational fields

entry.title: Thermodynamical aspects of black holes in modified gravity
entry.summary: We discuss some thermodynamical definitions for black holes in modified theories of gravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, proceeding of the Karl Schwarzschild Meeting 2017

entry.title: Results on exact solutions of low energy string theory
entry.summary: A family of solutions to low energy string theory is found. These solutions represent waves traveling along "extremal black strings"

entry.title: Euclidean Maxwell-Einstein Theory
entry.summary: After reviewing the context in which Euclidean propagation is useful we compare and contrast Euclidean and Lorentzian Maxwell-Einstein theory and give some examples of Euclidean solutions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, to appear in L. Witten Festschrift

entry.title: Hadamard States and Adiabatic Vacua
entry.summary: Reversing a slight detrimental effect of the mailer related to TeXability

entry.title: Mößbauer null redshift experiment II
entry.summary: Accurate limits for the violation of the Principle of Equivalence have been found from the comparison of the redshifts of two identical nuclear species in different chemical environments.

entry.title: Tunneling in Anisotropic Cosmological Models
entry.summary: Tunneling rate is investigated in homogenous and anisotropic cosmologies. The calculations is done by two methods: Euclidean and Hamiltonian approaches. It is found that the probability decreases exponentialy as anisotropy is increased.

entry.title: On Self-Dual Gravity I
entry.summary: (One typo corrected and one incorrect statement removed. Extra details on conserved quantities and symmetry algebras added).

entry.title: Symmetric solutions of Einstein-Yang-Mills equations
entry.summary: Symmetric gauge fields and invariant metrics in homogeneous spaces are found. Their use for finding exact solutions of the Einstein-Yang-Mills (EYM) equations is discussed.

entry.title: No Superluminal Expansion of the Universe
entry.summary: The apparent superluminal growth in the size of a sufficiently large part of the universe can be ascribed to the special relativistic effect of time dilation.

entry.title: Can quantum wormholes set $Lam$ 0
entry.summary: We find the quantum analogues of Carlini-Mijic wormholes and consider their application to the cosmological constant problem. In a simple model with $\Lambda$ only we differ with the results of Strominger.

entry.title: Perturbations of a topological defect as a theory of scalar fields interacting with an external vector potential
entry.summary: This is a revised version of gr-qc/9304033

entry.title: No New Symmetries of the Vacuum Einstein Equations
entry.summary: In this note we examine some recently proposed solutions of the linearized vacuum Einstein equations. We show that such solutions are {\it not} symmetries of the Einstein equations, because of a crucial integrability condition.

entry.title: Quantum State and Spontaneous Symmetry Breaking in Gravity
entry.summary: A spontaneous symmetry breaking mechanism is used in quantum gravity to obtain a convergent positive definite density-matrix as the most general quantum state of Euclidean wormholes

entry.title: Comments on Dragging Effects
entry.summary: This is a reply, given at the conference ``Mach's Principle" in T\"ubingen in July 1993, to the paper by Pfister (1993). Unfortunately the Pfister paper itself was not sent to gr-qc.

entry.title: Comments on Initial Value Formulation
entry.summary: This is the reply given at the conference ``Mach's Principle" at T\"ubingen in July 1993 to the paper by Isenberg (1993a). Unfortunately the Isenberg paper itself was not submitted to gr-qc.

entry.title: Wigner Functions in Curved Space-Time and Quantum Corrections to Thermal Equilibrium
entry.summary: A brief review of the Wigner functions method in curved space-time. Contribution to the 3rd International Wigner Symposium, 5th-11th September 1993, Oxford, UK.

entry.title: Semi-Complex Analysis & Mathematical Physics (Corrected Version)
entry.summary: A theoretical framework based on a simple quasi-number algebra is investigated in a treatment of space-time and gravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex (57 pages). Certain speculations introduced in Part III of the original paper have been withdrawn. Additional (minor) comments have been made

entry.title: Conformal Killing Vectors in Five-Dimensional Space
entry.summary: The solutions of generalized Killing equation have been obtained for line element with initial $t^2 \oplus so(3)$ symmetry. The coefficients of the metric $g$ corresponding to these vector fields are written down.

entry.title: Eternal inflation and the initial singularity
entry.summary: It is shown that a physically reasonable spacetime that is eternally inflating to the future must possess an initial singularity.

entry.title: On the alternative description of complex holomorphic and Lorentz geometries in four dimensions. II. Appendix
entry.summary: This supplementary part of the paper gr-qc 9312038 contains the necessary proofs of the claims stated in the main part.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, uuencoded compressed PostScript, no number

entry.title: Gravitating Solitons and Hairy Black Holes
entry.summary: A brief review of recent research on soliton and black hole solutions of Einstein's equations with nonlinear field sources is presented and some open questions are pointed out.

entry.title: "No Hair" Theorems -- Folklore, Conjectures, Results
entry.summary: Various assumptions underlying the uniqueness theorems for black holes are discussed. Some new results are described, and various unsatisfactory features of the present theory are stressed.

entry.title: The isolation of gravitational instantons: Flat tori V flat R^4
entry.summary: The role of topology in the perturbative solution of the Euclidean Einstein equations about flat instantons is examined.

entry.title: Black Hole Thermodynamics in a Box
entry.summary: Simple calculations indicate that the partition function for a black hole is defined only if the temperature is fixed on a finite boundary. Consequences of this result are discussed. (Contribution to the Proceedings of the Lanczos Centenary Conference.)

entry.title: Exotic Black Holes
entry.summary: Black hole solutions can be used to shed light on general issues in General Relativity and Quantum Physics. Black--hole hair, entropy and naked singularities are considered here, along with some implications for the inflationary universe scenario.

entry.title: Comment on ``Meaning of the Wave Function''
entry.summary: We draw attention to an elementary flaw in a recently proposed experiment to measure the wave function of a single quantum system.

entry.title: Semiclassical Gravity and the Problem of Time
entry.summary: I give a brief review of the recovery of semiclassical time from quantum gravity and discuss possible extrapolations of this concept to the full theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LATEX, Report Freiburg THEP-94/4, Contribution for the Lanczos Conference Proceedings

entry.title: Comments on "Objectification of classical properties induced by quantum vacuum fluctuations"
entry.summary: We argue that in standard quantum electrodynamics radiative corrections do not lead to decoherence of unexcited atomic systems. The proposal of Santos relies upon deliberate switching on and off the vacuum interactions.

entry.title: Classical solutions of gravitating Chern-Simons electrodynamics
entry.summary: We discuss the reduction of gravitating Chern-Simons electrodynamics with two commuting Killing vectors to a dynamical problem with four degrees of freedom, and present regular particle-like solutions.

entry.title: A Class of Quasi-Stationary Regular Line Elements for the Schwarzschild Geometry
entry.summary: A one-fold infinity of explicit quasi-stationary regular line elements for the Schwarzschild geometry is obtained directly from the vacuum Einstein equations. The class includes the familiar Eddington-Finkelstein coordinates, and the coordinates discussed recently by Kraus and Wilczek.

entry.title: The Spectral Analysis Inner Product for Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: This submission to the Proceedings of the Seventh Marcel-Grossman Conference is an advertisement for the use of the ``spectral analysis inner product" for minisuperspace models in quantum gravity.

entry.title: Thermodynamic Stability of a Multi-Bubble Cosmological Model
entry.summary: Multibubble solutions for a cosmological model which lead to thermal inflationary states due to a semi-classical tunneling of gravity are calculated.
entry.arxiv:comment: talk at Seventh Marcel Grossman Meeting, Stanford, July 1994, 6p, one figure is included

entry.title: Continuously Diagonalized Density Operatorof Open Systems
entry.summary: We showed several years ago that the density operator of Markovian open systems can be diagonalized continuously in time. The resulting pure state jump processes correspond to quantum trajectories proposed in recent quantum optics calculations or, at fundamental level, to exact consistent histories.

entry.title: Note on Massive Spin 2 in Curved Space
entry.summary: We give a Hamiltonian formulation of massive spin 2 theory in arbitrary Einstein space-times. We pay particular attention to Higuchi's forbidden mass range in deSitter space.

entry.title: Gravity in 2+1 dimensions
entry.summary: A review is given of some classical and quantum aspects of 2+1 dimensional gravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: Two lectures given at the XI Italian Relativity Meeting, Trieste 26-30 September 1994 ; 30 pages plain TeX, no figures

entry.title: General relativity and experiment
entry.summary: The confrontation between Einstein's theory of gravitation and experiment is summarized. Although all current experimental data are compatible with general relativity, the importance of pursuing the quest for possible deviations from Einstein's theory is emphasized.

entry.title: Numerical Relativity and Black Hole Horizons
entry.summary: I report on recent progress in the exciting field of Numerical Relativity, with special attention to black hole horizons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, uuencoded gzip-compressed ps file including 2 Figs. Also available at http://jean-luc.ncsa.uiuc.edu/Papers/ To appear in the ERE 94 (Menorca, Spain, Sept 94) proceedings

entry.title: Inflating Defects
entry.summary: A Kantowski-Sachs cosmological model with an O(3) global defect as a source is studied in the context of the topological inflation scenario.

entry.title: Lower Dimensional Black Holes: Inside and Out
entry.summary: I survey the physics of black holes in two and three spacetime dimensions, with special attention given to an understanding of their exterior and interior properties.
entry.arxiv:comment: 27 pages. Latex, invited talk given at Winnipeg conference on Heat Kernels and Quantum Gravity

entry.title: Weak Classical-Gravity Source in Standpoint Cosmology
entry.summary: Guided by a linearized approximation to Einstein theory, an interim prescription for ``weak source of gravity'' - - in ``particle'' energy-momentum distributed along standpoint light cone - - is formulated for (classical) standpoint cosmology.

entry.title: The constant mean curvature slices of asymptotically flat spherical spacetimes
entry.summary: We investigate the formation of trapped surfaces in asymptotically flat spherical spacetimes, using constant mean curvature slicing.

entry.title: Concerning the vacuum velocity of gravitational waves
entry.summary: It is pointed out that if gravitational interactions among ordinary bodies propagate in extra space-time dimensions the velocity of gravitational waves in vacuum could be different from the speed of light $c$.

entry.title: Hartle-Hawking state in supersymmetric minisuperspace
entry.summary: The Hartle-Hawking `no-boundary' state is constructed explicitly for the recently developed supersymmetric minisuperspace model with non-vanishing fermion number.

entry.title: Singularity Theory in Classical Cosmology
entry.summary: This paper compares recent approaches appearing in the literature on the singularity problem for space-times with nonvanishing torsion.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, plain-tex, published in Nuovo Cimento B, volume 107, pages 849-851, year 1992

entry.title: Cosmic Strings from N=2, D=5 Supergravity
entry.summary: Exact solutions of N=2 supergravity in five dimensions are found in the metric with cylindrical symmetry, a particular case corresponds to the exterior of a cosmic string.

entry.title: Boosting the Kerr-geometry into an arbitrary direction
entry.summary: We generalize previous work \cite{BaNa3} on the ultrarelativistic limit of the Kerr-geometry by lifting the restriction on boosting along the axis of symmetry.

entry.title: Primordial Density Fluctuations in Phase Coupling Gravity
entry.summary: In this paper we study the evolution of density perturbations in the framework of Phase Coupling Gravity theory at the very early universe. We show that these perturbation display an exponential-like behaviour.

entry.title: Dirac versus reduced quantization and operator ordering
entry.summary: We show an equivalence between Dirac quantization and the reduced phase space quantization. The equivalence of the both quantization methods determines the operator ordering of the Hamiltonian. Some examples of the operator ordering are shown in simple models.

entry.title: On Local Observations in Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: By taking into account both quantum mechanical and general relativistic effects, I derive an equation that describes limitations on the measurability of space-time distances as defined by a material reference system.

entry.title: On the link between Shrodinger and Vlasov Equations
entry.summary: It is shown that well-known Vlasov equation can be derived by adding "hidden" degrees of freedom and subsequent quantization. The Shrodinger equation obtained in this manner coincides (in x-representation) with the kinetic equation for the original dynamical system

entry.title: The Gravitational Energy of a Point Mass is Finite
entry.summary: We argue that our equation of gravitation ( Phys.Lett. A 156 (1991) 404 ) lead in pseudo-Euclidean space-time to the finite energy of the gravitational field of a point mass.

entry.title: Superoscillations and trans-Planckian frequencies
entry.summary: Superoscillations can explain the arbitrarily high frequencies' paradox in black hole radiation

entry.title: The Lense--Thirring Effect and Mach's Principle
entry.summary: We respond to a recent paper by Rindler on the ``Anti--Machian'' nature of the Lense--Thirring effect. We remark that his conclusion depends crucially on the particular formulation of Mach's principle used.

entry.title: Statistical Mechanical Entropy of Two-Dimensional Black Holes
entry.summary: We calculate the statistical mechanical entropy associated with boundary terms in the two-dimensional Euclidean black holes in deSitter gravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: Important acknowledgments added; typos corrected. Uses sprocl.sty

entry.title: Schwarzschild solution and Mach's principle
entry.summary: The purpose of this work is to show a possible reconciliation between Mach's principle and the Schwarzschild solution, using a description of this solution in terms of a new radial cooordinate related to the behaviour of Unruh detectors.

entry.title: Gauss-Bonnet type identity in Weyl-Cartan space
entry.summary: The Gauss-Bonnet type identity is derived in a Weyl-Cartan space on the basis of the variational method.

author.name: O. V. Babourova
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Moscow State Pedagogical University

author.name: B. N. Frolov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Moscow State Pedagogical University

entry.title: The black hole that went away
entry.summary: A purported black hole solution in (2+1)-dimensions is shown to be nothing more than flat space viewed from an accelerated frame.

entry.title: Gravitional coupling constant in higher dimensions
entry.summary: Assuming the equivalence of FRW-cosmological models and their Newtonian counterparts, we propose using the Gauss law in arbitrary dimension a general relation between the Newtonian gravitational constant G and the gravitational coupling constant \kappa.

entry.title: On rigidity of analytic black holes
entry.summary: We establish global extendibility (to the domain of outer communications) of locally defined isometries of appropriately regular analytic black holes. This allows us to fill a gap in the Hawking-Ellis proof of black-hole rigidity.

entry.title: Implosion of quadrupole gravitational waves
entry.summary: Einstein's vacuum equations are solved up to the second approximation for imploding quadrupole gravitational waves. The implosion generates a black hole singularity irrespective of the strength of the waves.

entry.title: A Comment on The A/4 Black Hole Entropy
entry.summary: Using a simple analysis based on the measurement procedure for a quantized area we explain the 1/4 factor in the Bekenstein-Hawking black hole formula A/4 for the entropy.

entry.title: Exact Inhomogeneous Cosmological Models
entry.summary: We present new exact inhomogeneous vacuum cosmological solutions of Einstein's equations. They provide new information about the nature of general cosmological solutions to Einstein's equations.

entry.title: About Time
entry.summary: The concept of time is discussed in the context of the canonical formulation of the gravitational field. Using a hypersurface orthogonal foliation, the arbitrariness of the lapse function is eliminated and the shift vector vanishes, allowing a consistent definition of time.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Revtex, no figures, email maia@mat.unb.br

entry.title: Dirac symmetry operators from conformal Killing-Yano tensors
entry.summary: We show how, for all dimensions and signatures, a symmetry operator for the massless Dirac equation can be constructed from a conformal Killing-Yano tensor of arbitrary degree.

entry.title: Gravitational Correction in Neutrino Oscillations
entry.summary: We investigate the quantum mechanical oscillations of neutrinos propagating in weak gravitational field. The correction to the result in the flat space-time is derived.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, Latex file without figures , accepted for publication in Modern Physics Letters A

entry.title: All conformally flat pure radiation metrics
entry.summary: The complete class of conformally flat, pure radiation metrics is given, generalising the metric recently given by Wils.

entry.title: Non-Abelian Surprises in Gravity
entry.summary: We present a brief review of some recent results on non-abelian solitons and black holes in different theories. Lecture given at the Simi-96, Tbilisi, Georgia, September 22-28, 1996.

entry.title: On the Significance of the Fifth Coordinate in Wesson's Version of Kaluza-Klein Theory
entry.summary: It is argued that the fifth coordinate should correspond to an intensive parameter rather than to rest-mass as originally proposed by Wesson.

entry.title: Literal Rippling of Spacetime
entry.summary: The metric perturbation tensor corresponding to a transverse oscillation of spacetime is composed of products of cosines. When averaged over many wavelengths, such a metric may look either Minkowskian or Euclidean at large scales, depending on the amplitude and wavelength of the oscillation.

entry.title: How to define a unique vacuum in cosmology
entry.summary: We propose a distinguished set of positive and negative energy modes of the Klein-Gordon equation as a time independent definition of the vacuum state of a quantized scalar field.

entry.title: On the null surface formalism -- Formulation in three dimensions and gauge freedom
entry.summary: The null surface formalism of GR in three dimensions is presented, and the gauge freedom thereof, which is not just diffeomorphism, is discussed briefly.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, LaTeX. To appear in Proceedings of the sixth workshop on General Relativity and Gravitation

entry.title: Can Temperature Be Quantized?
entry.summary: It is shown that the temperature may be quantized in some spacetime due to the periodically topological structure of the Euclidean section. The quanta of the temperature is the Hawking-Unruh temperature.

entry.title: Notes on the Generalised Second Law of Thermodynamics
entry.summary: Several comments are given to previous proofs of the generalised second law of thermodynamics: black hole entropy plus ordinary matter entropy never decreases for a thermally closed system. Arguments in favour of its truism are given in the spirit of conventional thermodynamics.

entry.title: Against ``Against Many-Worlds Interpretations''
entry.summary: The paper entitled ``Against Many-Worlds Interpretations'' by A. Kent, which has recently been submitted to the e-Print archive (gr-qc/9703089) contained some misconceptions. The claims on Everett's many-worlds interpretation are quoted and answered.

entry.title: On the Antenna Pattern of an Orbiting Interferometer
entry.summary: The response of an interferometer changing its orientation with respect to a fixed reference frame is given in terms of the beam-pattern factors and the polarization-averaged antenna power pattern.
entry.arxiv:comment: RevTeX, 17 pages, 11 ps figures. To appear in MNRAS

entry.title: On ``minimally curved spacetimes'' in general relativity
entry.summary: We consider a spacetime corresponding to uniform relativistic potential analogus to Newtonian potential as an example of ``minimally curved spacetime''. We also consider a radially symmetric analogue of the Rindler spacetime of uniform proper acceleration relative to infinity.

entry.title: Colliding plane waves with W=M=0
entry.summary: It is shown that there are three vacuum and one electrovacuum solutions of diagonal plane waves with M=0 and constant Maxwell scalars. Namely, these are the single wave, Stoyanov, Babala and Bell-Szekeres solutions. A comparison is made with the planar solutions of Taub.

entry.title: Supersymmetric Action for FRW Model with Complex Matter Field
entry.summary: On the basis of the local n=2 supersymmetry we construct the supersymmetric action for a set of complex scalar supermultiplets in the FRW model. This action corresponds to the dilaton-axion and chiral components of supergravity theory.

entry.title: On a certain formulation of the Einstein equations
entry.summary: We define a certain differential system on an open set of $R^6$. The system locally defines a Lorentzian 4-manifold satisfying the Einstein equations. The converse statement is indicated and its details are postponed to the furthcoming paper.

entry.title: Inertia as the ``Threshold of Elasticity'' of Quantum States
entry.summary: A quantum mechanism of the inertia generation has been proposed. The threshold of the parametric instability of ``goemetric'' Goldstone modes is treated as a rest mass.

entry.title: Solutions of Quantum Gravity Coupled to the Scalar Field
entry.summary: We consider the Wheeler-De Witt equation for canonical quantum gravity coupled to massless scalar field. After regularizing and renormalizing this equation, we find a one-parameter class of its solutions.

entry.title: Combinatorial Tools for Regge Calculus
entry.summary: In this short note we briefly review some recent mathematical results relevant to the classical Regge Calculus evolution problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LaTeX, no figures. To appear on the Proceedings of the 12th Italian Conference on General Relativity and Gravitational Physics

entry.title: Textures and Newtonian Gravity
entry.summary: Newtonian theory is used to study the gravitational effects of a texture, in particular the formation of massive structures.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 4 ps figures, REVTEX, accepted for publication in PRD

entry.title: Singularities, initial and boundary problems for the Tolman-Bondi model
entry.summary: Boundary problem for Tolman-Bondi model is formulated. One-to-one correspondence between singularities hypersurfaces and initial conditions of the Tolman-Bondi model is constructed.

entry.title: The Cavendish Experiment in General Relativity
entry.summary: Solutions of Einstein's equations are discussed in which the ``gravitational force" is balanced by an electrical force, and which can serve as models for the Cavendish experiment.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, LaTeX. Contribution to Festschrift volume for Engelbert Schucking

entry.title: Answer to question Nr. 55
entry.summary: We answer to question Nr. 55 [Are there pictorial examples that distinguish covariant and contravariant vectors ?] posed by D. Neuenschwander, Am. J. Phys. 65 (1), 11 (1997)
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX, 2 figures, Am. J. Phys. in print

entry.title: Wigner Functions in Curved Spacetimes and Deformation Quantisation of Constrained Systems
entry.summary: We first generalise the standard Wigner function to Dirac fermions in curved spacetimes. Secondly, we turn to the Moyal quantisation of systems with constraints. Gravity is used as an example.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to the Proceedings of the Fifth Wigner Symposium, Vienna 1997. Uses sprocl.sty

entry.title: Black holes and radiometry
entry.summary: Following Grischuk and Sidorov [Phys. Rev. D 42 (1990) 3413] in putting the Bogolubov-Hawking coefficient of Schwarzschild black-holes in the squeezing perspective, we provide a short discussion of Schwarzschild black holes as radiometric standards

entry.title: Baryogenesis motivated on String CPT Violation
entry.summary: We discuss a mechanism for generating the baryon asymetry of the Universe that involves a putative violation of CPT symmetry arising from string interactions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, plain Latex (requires mproc.sty available at http://shemesh.fiz.huji.ac.il/MG8/submition.html). Talk delivered at the Early Universe session at the 8th Marcel Grossmann Meeting

entry.title: The Time Evolution of Quantum Universe in The Quantum Potential Picture
entry.summary: We use the quantum potential approach to analyse the quantum cosmological model of the universe. The quantum potential arises from exact solutions of the full Wheeler-De Witt equation.

entry.title: Microcanonical Quantum Statistics of Schwarzschild Black Holes
entry.summary: It is shown that a quantized Schwarzschild black hole, if described by a square root energy spectrum with exponential multiplicity, can be treated as a microcanonical ensemble without problem leading to the expected thermodynamical properties.

entry.title: Dynamical Spacetime and the Curvature of Projective State Space
entry.summary: If universal quantum interaction is really connected with the coset structure of deformations of quantum states then the curvature of projective Hilbert state space should be observable. I discuss some approach to the measurement of curvature-dependent values.

entry.title: Smarr's Formula for Black Holes in String Theory
entry.summary: We investigate thermodynamical properties of four and five dimensional black hole solutions of toroidally compactified string theory. We derive an analog of Smarr's formula and verify it directly using the metric.

entry.title: Technological picture of the Planck scale universe
entry.summary: A picture of the Planck scale universe as a network of mesoscopic (with respect to that scale) resonators connected through quasi-one-dimensional waveguides is presented

entry.title: On the PPN 1+2 Body Problem
entry.summary: A particulare case of the three-body problem, in the PPN formalism, is presented. The Hamiltonian function is obtained and the problem is reduced to a perturbed two-body one.

entry.title: Tail of Gravitational Radiation and Coulomb Final-State Interaction
entry.summary: We present a simple intuitive derivation of the corrections to the intensity of gravitational radiation due to the so-called tail effect.

entry.title: Cosmological Levinson theorem
entry.summary: If at least some Wheeler-DeWitt solutions can be interpreted as zero-energy resonances then the total s-wave cross section of the corresponding quantum universes is infinite

entry.title: Multidimensional Gravity and Cosmology: Exact Solutions
entry.summary: A short review of recent results on exact solutions in multidimensional cosmology and overview of reports at workshop in MG8 (held by the author) are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, Latex. To appear in Proceedings of MG8 Meeting, Jerusalem, 1997 (World Scientific, Singapore)

entry.title: Multidimensional Gravity with p-branes
entry.summary: A short review of recent results of authors on sigma-model approach in multidimensional gravity with p-branes is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Latex. To appear in Proceedings of MG8 Meeting, Jerusalem, 1997 (World Scientific, Singapore)

entry.title: Instability of three dimensional conformally dressed black hole
entry.summary: The three dimensional black hole solution of Einstein equations with negative cosmological constant coupled to a conformal scalar field is proved to be unstable against linear circularly symmetric perturbations.

entry.title: GR15 Workshop A3 --- Mathematical Studies of Field Equations --- A report
entry.summary: This is a report of the A3 workshop ("Mathematical Studies of Field Equations"), which was held in Poone during the GR15 Conference in December 1997.

entry.title: Summary of GR15 Session D1(1), Quantum General Relativity
entry.summary: This summary was prepared for the proceedings of the GR15 conference in Pune, India in Dec. 1997.

entry.title: Quantum Fields in Curved Spacetimes and Semiclassical Approaches: A Workshop Summary
entry.summary: I briefly review some of the recent progress in quantum field theory in curved spacetime and other aspects of semiclassical gravity, as reported at the D3 Workshop at GR15.

entry.title: Gravitational light bending in Euclidean space
entry.summary: Both the non-homogeneous slowness of electromagnetic waves in gravitational fields and the frequency red shift contribute to the gravitational light bending. This twofold contribution explains the measured deflection of light rays by the Sun under Euclidean geometry of space.

entry.title: A remark on Ma's "Cosmic gravitational background radiation"
entry.summary: The calculations of Guang-Wen Ma's recent Letter [Phys.Lett. A239, (1998) 209] contain an easily detectable error which makes his conclusions irrelevant.

entry.title: Chaos in pp-wave spacetimes
entry.summary: We demonstrate chaotic behavior of timelike, null and spacelike geodesics in non-homogeneous vacuum pp-wave solutions. This seems to be the first known example of a chaotic motion in exact radiative spacetime.

entry.title: The effective cosmological constant in higher order gravity theories
entry.summary: An effective time--dependent cosmological constant can be recovered for higher--order theories of gravity by extending to these ones the no--hair conjecture. The results are applied to some specific cosmological models.

entry.title: Solar-System Experiments and Saa's Model of Gravity with Propagating Torsion
entry.summary: It's shown that Saa's model of gravity with propagating torsion is inconsistent with basic solar-system gravitational experiments.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, latex, no figures. Typos corrected

entry.title: Ermakov approach for empty FRW minisuperspace oscillators
entry.summary: The formal Ermakov approach for empty FRW minisuperspace cosmological models of arbitrary Hartle-Hawking factor ordering and the corresponding squeezing features are briefly discussed as a possible means of describing cosmological evolution

entry.title: Superluminal travel requires negative energies
entry.summary: The content of gr-qc/9805003 and gr-qc/9806091 now appears in a single paper in the archive under gr-qc/9805003, since these appeared as a single publication in Physical Review Letters.

entry.title: Free Fields for Chiral 2D Dilaton Gravity
entry.summary: We give an explicit canonical transformation which transforms a generic chiral 2D dilaton gravity model into a free field theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX file, 4 pages, to appear in Phys. Rev. D

entry.title: A nonlinear theory of tensor distributions
entry.summary: The coordinate invariant theory of generalised functions of Colombeau and Meril is reviewed and extended to enable the construction of multi-index generalised tensor functions whose transformation laws coincide with their counterparts in classical distribution theory.

entry.title: Comment on ``Theorem for nonrotating singularity-free universes''
entry.summary: We show that Raychaudhuri's recently proposed theorem on nonrotating universes cannot be used to rule out realistic singularity-free descriptions of the universe, as suggested by him in PRL 80, 654 (1998).

entry.title: Real Tunneling and Black Hole Creation
entry.summary: The concept of constrained gravitational instanton is introduced. It is used to study black hole creation. We discussed the global aspects of the scenario and the alternative tunnelings.

entry.title: Chaos after Two-Field Inflation
entry.summary: We show that two-field inflation can be followed by an era in which the field dynamics become chaotic, and discuss the possible consequences of this for two-field inflationary models. [PASCOS conference proceedings - a short version of gr-qc/9711035]

entry.title: Wavy Horizons?
entry.summary: We describe the application of a gravity wave-generating technique to certain higher dimensional black holes. We find that the induced waves generically destroy the event horizon producing parallelly propagated curvature singularities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, Based on a talk at the 7th CCGRRA meeting (May 31 - June 7, 1997)

entry.title: Solutions of Schlesinger system and Ernst equation in terms of theta-functions
entry.summary: We discuss the relationship between Schlesinger system and stationary axisymmetric Einstein's equation on the level of algebro-geometric solutions. In particular, we calculate all metric coefficients corresponding to solutions of Ernst equation in terms of theta-functions.

entry.title: Simple Formulas for Generating Chern-Simons Basic Invariant Polynomials by Repeated Exterior Differentiation
entry.summary: Simple formulas are given for generating Chern-Simons basic invariant polynomials by repeated exterior differentiation for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

entry.title: A Stationary Asymptotically Einstein Static Universe Solution
entry.summary: Here I present a stationary cylindrically symmetric asymptotically Einstein static universe solution with the matter consisting of a cosmological and rotating dust term which admits predicted black hole event horizon.

entry.title: Direct generation of spinning Einstein--Maxwell fields from static fields
entry.summary: I present a new method to generate rotating solutions of the Einstein--Maxwell equations from static solutions, and briefly discuss its general properties.

entry.title: Black Holes in Higher Curvature Gravity
entry.summary: A review of recent investigations of black holes in higher curvature theories of gravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages; Latex, requires crckapb.sty; to appear in "Black Holes, Gravitational Radiation, and the Universe"

entry.title: Colliding spherically symmetric null dust in equilibrium
entry.summary: We present two recently obtained solutions of the Einstein equations with spherical symmetry and one additional Killing vector, describing colliding null dust streams.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figure, sprocl.sty included, to appear in the Proceedings of the ERES98 Conference

entry.title: Static Cylindrically Symmetric Solution
entry.summary: A static axisymmetric solution with an additional cylindrical symmetry is considered and that the matter consists in a cosmological and a dust term.

entry.title: Cosmological Birefringence and the Microwave Background
entry.summary: We show that significant anisotropy in electromagnetic propagation generates a distinctive signature in the microwave background. The anisotropy may be determined by looking at the cross correlator of the $E$-mode and $B$-mode polarisation spectrum.

entry.title: The Immortal Bel-Robinson Tensor
entry.summary: We present some generalizations, and novel properties, of the Bel-Robinson tensor, in the context of constructing local invariants in D=11 supergravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. Lecture at Iberian Gravity Symposium to appear in "Gravitation and Relativity in General", World Publishing (1999)
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Gravitation and Relativity in general (World Pub 1999)

entry.title: A comment on gr-qc/9901053
entry.summary: In eprint gr-qc/9901053 Gen Yoneda and Hisa-aki Shinkai have made several claims disputing our results in gr-qc/9710004, and gr-qc/9804019. We show here that these claims are not correct.

entry.title: On the incompatibility of experiments confirming certain conclusions of the general relativity
entry.summary: Qualitativ arguments are presented which show the incompatibility of the positive results obtaned in experiments on the gravitational redshift of photones and in experiments investigating the behavior of clocks in the gravitational field.

entry.title: Remark on the strength of singularities with a C^0 metric
entry.summary: Recently Nolan constructed a spherically-symmetric spacetime admitting a spacelike curvature singularity with a regular C^0 metric. We show here that this singularity is in fact weak.

entry.title: A Family of Gravitational Waveforms from Rapidly Rotating Neutron Stars
entry.summary: This note describes fitting formulae for the gravitational waveforms generated by a rapidly rotating neutron star (e.g., newly-formed in the core collapse of a supernova) as it evolves from an initial axisymmetric configuration toward a triaxial ellipsoid.

entry.title: Relativistic Spheres
entry.summary: By analyzing the Einstein's equations for the static sphere, we find that there exists a non-singular static configuration whose radius can approach its corresponding horizon size arbitrarily.

entry.title: Some General Expressions for the Coefficient of the 14th Chern Form
entry.summary: Some general expressions are given for the coefficient of the 14th Chern form in terms of the Riemann-Christoffel curvature tensor and some of its concomitants (e.g., Pontrjagin's characteristic tensors) for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

entry.title: A General Expression for the 14th Chern Form
entry.summary: A general expression is given for the 14th Chern form in terms of simple polynomial concomitants of the curvature 2-form for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

entry.title: General Expressions for Chern Forms Up to the 13th Order in Curvature
entry.summary: General expressions are given for Chern forms up to the 13th order in curvature in terms of simple polynomial concomitants of the curvature 2-form for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

entry.title: Nonlinear Lagrangians of the Ricci type
entry.summary: The Euler-Lagrange equations for some class of gravitational actions are calculated by means of Palatini principle. Polynomial structures with Einstein metrics appear among extremals of this variational problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages in LaTeX, to appear in Reports on Mathematical Physics

entry.title: Null infinity and an electromagnetic analog of the relativistic Kepler problem
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. It has come to my attention that most of the results reported here have already been obtained by Ludvigsen.

entry.title: The observable light deflection angle
entry.summary: The physical deflection angle of a light ray propagating in a space-time supplied with an asymptotically flat metric has to be expressed in terms of the impact parameter.

entry.title: Local twistors and the conformal field equations
entry.summary: This note establishes the connection between Friedrich's conformal field equations and the conformally invariant formalism of local twistors.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX2e Minor corrections of misprints etc

entry.title: Newman-Janis method and rotating dilaton-axion black hole
entry.summary: It's shown that the rotating dilaton-axion black hole solution can be obtained from GGHS static charged dilaton black hole solution via Newman-Janis method.

entry.title: Higher Dimensional Analogue of McVittie Solution
entry.summary: A generalization of the McVittie solution, representing spacetime of a mass particle placed in (n+2) dimensional Robertson-Walker universe is reported.

entry.title: Waves and uniformity of space-times
entry.summary: Undulatory field functions represent a real wave only if there exists a class of infinite reference systems for which an identical wave is described by the same functional forms.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, PDF from MS-Word97, submitted to Il Nuovo Cimento, Section B

entry.title: The Relativistic Transformation to Rotating Frames
entry.summary: We present a critical review of the relativistic rotation transformation of Trocheris and Takeno. A new transformation is proposed which is free from the drawbacks of the former. Some applications are presented.

entry.title: Complex Geometry of Nature and General Relativity
entry.summary: An attempt is made of giving a self-contained introduction to holomorphic ideas in general relativity, following work over the last thirty years by several authors. The main topics are complex manifolds, spinor and twistor methods, heaven spaces.

entry.title: Tetrad Gravity and Dirac's Observables
entry.summary: Talk given at the Conference ``Constrained Dynamics and Quantum Gravity 99'', Villasimius (Sardinia, Italy), September 13-17, 1999

entry.title: A Possible Theoretical Basis for Propulsive Force Generation by Both Conventional and Unconventional Means
entry.summary: A possible theoretical basis is given for propulsive force generation by both conventional and unconventional means.

entry.title: Gravitational waves from quasi-spherical black holes
entry.summary: A quasi-spherical approximation scheme, intended to apply to coalescing black holes, allows the waveforms of gravitational radiation to be computed by integrating ordinary differential equations.

entry.title: Acceleration and Special Relativity
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to similarity to Author's other paper

entry.title: On existence of mini-boson stars
entry.summary: We prove the existence of a countable family of globally regular solutions of spherically symmetric Einstein-Klein-Gordon equations. These solutions, known as mini-boson stars, were discovered numerically many years ago.

entry.title: Fermat-holonomic congruences
entry.summary: Fermat-holonomic congruences are proposed as a weaker substitute for the too restrictive class of Born-rigid motions. The definition is expressed as a set of differential equations. Integrability conditions and Cauchy data are studied.

entry.title: Closed Lightlike Curves in Non-linear Electrodynamics
entry.summary: We show that non-linear electrodynamics may induce a photon to follow a closed path in spacetime. We exhibit a specific case in which such closed lightlike curve (CLC) appears

entry.title: Post-Newtonian Gravitational Radiation
entry.summary: 1 Introduction 2 Multipole Decomposition 3 Source Multipole Moments 4 Post-Minkowskian Approximation 5 Radiative Multipole Moments 6 Post-Newtonian Approximation 7 Point-Particles 8 Conclusion
entry.arxiv:comment: 46 pages, in Einstein's Field Equations and Their Physical Implications, B. Schmidt (Ed.), Lecture Notes in Physics, Springer

entry.title: Equivalent frames in Brans-Dicke theory
entry.summary: We discuss the physical equivalence between the Einstein and Jordan frames in Brans-Dicke theory. The inequivalence of conformal transformed theories is clarified with the help of an old equivalence theorem of Chrisholm's.

entry.title: The interaction force between rotating black holes at equilibrium
entry.summary: We study the previously constructed Riemann problem whose solutions correspond to equilibrium configurations of black holes. We evaluate the metric coefficients at the symmetry axis and the interaction force between the black holes.

entry.title: de Broglie oscillation, rest mass and inertia
entry.summary: The model of a relativistic free massive point particle is investigated in the context of a Hamiltonian constraint system. It is shown that de Broglie oscillation, rest mass and inertia may be described within this model of Hamiltonian constraint system.

entry.title: The classical regime of a quantum universe obtained through a functional method
entry.summary: The functional method, introduced to deal with systems endowed with a continuous spectrum, is used to study the problem of decoherence and correlations in a simple cosmological model.

entry.title: Entropy gap and time asymmetry II
entry.summary: In this letter the paper [R. Aquilano, M. Castagnino, Mod. Phys. Lett A,11, 755 (1996)] is improved by considering that the main source of entropy production are the stars photospheres.

entry.title: Functional Approach to Quantum Decoherence and the Classical Final Limit: the Mott and Cosmological problems
entry.summary: Decoherence and the approach to the classical final limit are studied in two similar cases: the Mott and the Cosmological problems.

entry.title: Answer to the Comment about the Letter entitled ``Scalar fields as dark matter in spiral galaxies''
entry.summary: In this manuscript the authors present a detailed answer to the comment in order to avoid misunderstandings in the future.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, latex. An answer to a comment uploaded yesterday: gr-qc/0006051

entry.title: Electrostatic self-energy in static black holes with spherical symmetry
entry.summary: We determine the expression of the electrostatic self-energy for a point charge in the static black holes with spherical symmetry having suitable properties

entry.title: On the propagation speed of wavy metric tensors
entry.summary: The undulating metric tensors of general relativity do not possess a special and common velocity of propagation. Indeed, their velocity can even coincide with the speed of thought.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.title: Black hole horizon and space-time foam
entry.summary: We introduce, by means of the Brans-Dicke scalar field, space-time fluctuations at scale comparable to Planck length near the event horizon of a black hole and examine their dramatic effects.

entry.title: Black holes: new horizons
entry.summary: This is a review of current black-hole theory, concentrating on local, dynamical aspects.
entry.arxiv:comment: Expanded version of the brief talk given to open the Generalized Horizons of the Ninth Marcel Grossmann Meeting (7 revtex pages, 4 eps figures, minor changes)

entry.title: Moving-mirror entropy
entry.summary: We consider a quantized scalar field in a two-dimensional Minkowski spacetime with a moving mirror and propose a definition of moving-mirror entropy associated with temporarily inaccessible information about the future.

entry.title: Exact metric around a wiggly cosmic string
entry.summary: The exact metric around a wiggly cosmic string is found by modifying the energy momentum-tensor of a straight infinitely thin cosmic string to include an electric current along the symmetry axis.

entry.title: State sum models for quantum gravity
entry.summary: This paper reviews the construction of quantum field theory on a 4-dimensional spacetime by combinatorial methods, and discusses the recent developments in the direction of a combinatorial construction of quantum gravity.

entry.title: The Geometrical Generating of Gravity
entry.summary: the author considered it unmatured and withdraw it.
entry.arxiv:comment: the author considered it unmatured and withdraw it

entry.title: A List of References on Spacetime Splitting and Gravitoelectromagnetism
entry.summary: Revised version to be published in the Proceedings of the Encuentros Relativistas Espa\~noles, September, 2000 [ http://hades.eis.uva.es/EREs2000 ]
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, LaTeX article style. Please send corrections and additions to mailto:robert.jantzen@villanova.edu

entry.title: Energy Distribution of a Schwarzschild Black Hole in a Magnetic Universe
entry.summary: We obtain the energy distribution of a Schwarzschild black hole in a magnetic universe in the Tolman prescription.

entry.title: Energy of a Conformal Scalar Dyon Black Hole
entry.summary: We obtain the energy of a conformal scalar dyon black hole (CSD) by using the energy-momentum complexes of Tolman and M{\o}ller. The total gravitational energy is given by the CSD charge in the both prescriptions.

entry.title: EinS: a Mathematica package for computations with indexed objects
entry.summary: This preprint contains a description of a package for Mathematica called EinS. This package allows one to perform various calculations with indexed objects.
entry.arxiv:comment: User manual. For more information see http://rcswww.urz.tu-dresden.de/~klioner/eins.html

entry.title: Stable evolution of a maximally sliced Schwarzschild spacetime using a smooth lattice
entry.summary: We will present results of a long term stable evolution, to $t=1000m$, of a maximally sliced Schwarzschild blackhole using a smooth lattice method.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 4 eps figures, talk given at MG9, Rome, July 2000

entry.title: Energy Distribution of a Charged Regular Black Hole
entry.summary: We calculate the energy distribution of a charged regular black hole by using the energy-momentum complexes of Einstein and M{\o}ller.

entry.title: Fourth-Order Ricci Gravity
entry.summary: The Euler-Lagrange equations of motion for the most general Ricci type gravitational Lagrangians are derived by means of a purely metric formalism.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, latex, contribution to ICGTM "Group23" Dubna 2000

entry.title: Quiescent cosmological singularities
entry.summary: I discuss recent work (gr-qc/0001047) on non-oscillatory singularities in four dimensional space-times with scalar field or stiff fluid matter, in the context of the BKL proposal.

entry.title: 2D gravity without test particles is pointless (Comment on hep-th/0011136)
entry.summary: Claims of a general Weyl invariance of an arbitrary 2D dilaton theory are critically discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LaTex 3.14159, uses amsmath and amssymb

entry.title: Indeterminism and Time Symmetry are Incompatible: Reply to Rebilas
entry.summary: Rebilas argues that time-reversal can occur even in an indeterministic system. This hypothesis is untestable, hence lying beyond physics.

entry.title: Generalised hyperbolicity: hypersurface singularities
entry.summary: Sufficient conditions for the well-posedness of the initial value problem for the scalar wave equation are obtained in space-times with hypersurface singularities

author.name: J. A. Vickers
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, University of Southampton

author.name: J. P. Wilson
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, University of Southampton

entry.title: Comment on "Gravity Waves, Chaos, and Spinning Compact Binaries"
entry.summary: In this comment, I argue that chaotic effects in binary black hole inspiral will not strongly impact the detection of gravitational waves from such systems.

entry.title: Symmetric States in Quantum Geometry
entry.summary: Symmetric states are defined in the kinematical sector of loop quantum gravity and applied to spherical symmetry and homogeneity. Consequences for the physics of black holes and cosmology are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, talk at the Ninth Marcel Grossmann Meeting, Rome, July 2-8, 2000

entry.title: Curvature invariants in algebraically special spacetimes
entry.summary: It is well known that all curvature invariants of the order zero vanish for type-III and type-N vacuum spacetimes. We briefly summarize properties of higher order curvature invariants for these spacetimes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, contribution to the 9th Marcel Grossmann meeting (MG9), Rome, July 2000

entry.title: Length versus time-interval discreteness in 2+1 Lorentzian canonical quantum gravity
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn. Replaced by by gr-qc/0212077 .
entry.arxiv:comment: Paper withdrawn. Replaced by by gr-qc/0212077

entry.title: Symmetries of the Gowdy Equations and Spatial Topologies
entry.summary: We examine some kinds of discrete symmetries which are dynamically preserved, using the (generalized) Gowdy models of the first kind.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 2 figures, LaTeX. To appear in the proceedings of JGRG10, Osaka, Sept. 11-14, 2000

entry.title: Falaco Solitons, Cosmic Strings in a Swimming Pool
entry.summary: Topological defects experimentally induced by rotational dynamics in a continuous media replicate the coherent structure features of cosmic strings as well as hadrons.

entry.title: Momentum Imparted by Gravitational Waves with Spherical Wavefronts
entry.summary: A different approach has been used to evaluate the momentum imparted by the gravitational waves with spherical wavefronts. It is shown that the results obtained for momentum coincide with those already available in the literature.

entry.title: ''Homogeneous'' Gravitational Field in General Relativity ?
entry.summary: The gravitation field of the flat plate was investigated. It have been shown that there exist the internal solution of Einstein equations sewed together with external one, which described a ''homogeneous'' gravitational field.

entry.title: Spin and Rotation in General Relativity
entry.summary: Rapporteur's Introduction to the GT8 session of the Ninth Marcel Grossmann Meeting (Rome, 2000); to appear in the Proceedings.

author.name: Lewis H. Ryder
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Kent at Canterbury, UK

entry.title: Finitary Spacetime Sheaves
entry.summary: The notion of finitary spacetime sheaves is introduced based on locally finite approximations of the continuous topology of a bounded region of a spacetime manifold. Finitary spacetime sheaves are seen to be sound mathematical models of approximations of continuous spacetime observables.

entry.title: Introduction to relativistic astrophysics and cosmology through Maple
entry.summary: The basics of the relativistic astrophysics including the celestial mechanics in weak field, black holes and cosmological models are illustrated and analyzed by means of Maple 6
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 124 pages, 34 figures, maple2e.sty, worksheet is accessible on http://www.geocities.com/optomaplev

entry.title: Null Singularities in Colliding Waves
entry.summary: Colliding Einstein-Maxwell-Scalar fields need not necessarily doomed to become in a spacelike singularity. Examples are given in which null singularities emerge as intermediate stages between a spacelike singularity and a regular horizon.

entry.title: Algebraically special, expanding and twisting gravitational fields with vanishing NUT parameter
entry.summary: The system of Einstein-Maxwell equations for fields mentioned in the title is simplified. Known pure radiation solutions are systematized and new solutions are given by separating the variables.

entry.title: Expanding, axisymmetric pure-radiation gravitational fields with a simple twist
entry.summary: New expanding, axisymmetric pure-radiation solutions are found, exploiting the analogy with the Euler-Darboux equation for aligned colliding plane waves.

entry.title: The first BritGrav meeting
entry.summary: The first British Gravity Meeting was held at the University of Southampton, UK, on 27/28 March. 47 10-minute plenary talks were given. Here are the abstracts in the order given. A brief conference report will also appear in Matters of Gravity.

entry.title: Relativistic mechanics on rotating disk
entry.summary: We find equations of particle motion from the point of view of observer on a rotating disk, and demonstrate that a particle moving along a rotating disk is influenced by forces arising from geometry. They can be considered as analogs of the centrifugal forces and the Coriolis forces.

entry.title: A phenomenological description of quantum-gravity-induced space-time noise
entry.summary: I propose a phenomenological description of space-time foam and discuss the experimental limits that are within reach of forthcoming experiments.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, LaTex, 1 figure. Short paper, omitting most technical details. More detailed analysis was reported in gr-qc/0104005

entry.title: Observables of D=4 Euclidean Supergravity and Dirac Eigenvalues
entry.summary: Results on the observables of the Euclidean supergravity in terms of the Dirac eigenvalues are briefly revisited.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LATeX, submitted as constribution to "Concise Encyclopaedia of Supersymmetry"

entry.title: Anisotropic fluids in the case of stationary and axisymmetric spaces of General Relativity
entry.summary: We present a stationary axisymmetric solution belonging to Carter's family [A] of spaces and representing an anisotropic fluid configuration.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages,submitted to Int J Mod Phys D

entry.title: A comment on a proposal to use neutrons to reveal gravitomagnetic effects on Earth
entry.summary: Arguments are presented which show that the recent proposals of using neutrons to test gravitomagnetic effects on Earth are impracticable.

entry.title: Non-trivial Solutions of the Bach Equation Exist
entry.summary: We show that solutions of the Bach equation exist which are not conformal Einstein spaces.

entry.title: Supersymmetric quantum solution for FRW cosmological model with matter
