entry.summary: Using technique of supersymmetric quantum mechanics we present new cosmological quantum solution, in the regime for FRW cosmological model using a barotropic perfect fluid as matter field.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, Revtex, Submitted to Rev. Mex. Fis

entry.title: Microscopic Properties of Horizons
entry.summary: We suggest that all horizons of spacetime, no matter whether they are black hole, Rindler or de Sitter horizons, have certain microscopic properties in common. We propose that these propertues may be used as the starting points, or postulates, of a microscopic theory of gravity.

entry.title: Comment on 'Stability of the semiclassical Einstein equation'
entry.summary: Some mathematical errors of the paper commented upon [W.-M. Suen, Phys. Rev. D 40, (1989) 315] are corrected.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX, reprinted from Phys. Rev. D 50 (1994) 5452

entry.title: On space-times which cannot be distinguished by curvature invariants
entry.summary: We present an example that non-isometric space-times with non-vanishing curvature scalar cannot be distinguished by curvature invariants.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX, reprinted from Abstracts Conf. GR 14 (1995)

entry.title: On the Space of 3-dimensional Homogeneous Riemannian Manifolds
entry.summary: We answer the following question: Let l, m, n be arbitrary real numbers. Does there exist a 3-dimensional homogeneous Riemannian manifold whose eigenvalues of the Ricci tensor are just l, m and n ?
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX, reprinted from Proc. Conf. Brno (1995)

entry.title: Quantum Gravity on the Classical Background: Group Analysis, Part I
entry.summary: Quantization of gravitational field in the neighbourhood of exact solution of Einstein equation is considered. The method of Bogoliubov group variables is used.

entry.title: The Gravitational Cherenkov Radiation
entry.summary: An example of discontinuity of the energy-momentum tensor moving at superluminal velocity is discussed. It is shown that the gravitational Mach cone is formed. The power spectrum of the corresponding Cherenkov radiation is evaluated.

entry.title: A State Sum Model for (2+1) Lorentzian Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: A state sum model based on the group SU(1,1) is defined. Investigations of its geometry and asymptotics suggest it is a good candidate for modelling (2+1) Lorentzian quantum gravity.

entry.title: Time and Cosmic Clock
entry.summary: The nature of time vis-a-vis relativity is critically examined. Based on the author's space-time interaction hypothesis of late 1970's, cosmological model with time-varying velocity of light is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Prepared for Gravity Research Foundation Award 2001. Report IONP-5-2001

entry.title: New embedding of Schwarzschild geometry. I. Exterior solution
entry.summary: We propose a global minimal embedding of the Schwarzschild theory in a five-dimensional flat space by using two surfaces. Covariant field equations are deduced for the gravitational forces.

entry.title: Stationary Cylindrically Symmetric Solution Approaching Einstein's Cosmological Solution
entry.summary: Here we describe a stationary cylindrically symmetric solution of Einstein's equation with matter consisting of a positive cosmological and rotating dust term. The solution approaches Einstein static universe solution.

entry.title: Higher Dimensional Static Cosmological Model in Lyra Manifold
entry.summary: A static conformally flat spherically symmetric perfect fluid cosmological model in Lyra geometry is investigatd.

author.name: G. S. Khadekar
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Nagpur University, Nagpur, India

author.name: Avinash R. Nagpure
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Nagpur University, Nagpur, India

entry.title: Inertial forces - a la Newton in General Relativity
entry.summary: In this we briefly cover the covariant approach to describe inertial forces in general relativity and in particular look at the behaviour of the cumulative drag index for stationary Kerr geometry.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lecture notes 18 pages including five figs

entry.title: Anomalous dispersion of density waves in the early universe with positive cosmological constant
entry.summary: Density perturbations in the flat (K=0) Robertson-Walker universe with radiation ($p=\epsilon/3$) and positive cosmological constant ($\Lambda>0$) are investigated. The phenomenon of anomalous dispersion of acoustic waves on $\Lambda$ is discussed.

entry.title: Cosmology models with Ω_M-dependent cosmological constant
entry.summary: We investigate the evolution of the scale factor in a cosmological model in which the cosmological constant is given by the scalar arisen by the contraction of the stress-energy tensor.

entry.title: Relational Relativity
entry.summary: According to a simple model of inertia a Machianized theory of special and general relativity named as relational relativity is presented.

entry.title: Local criteria for the existence of an accelerated frame of reference
entry.summary: A local criteria for the existence of an accelerated frame of reference is found. An accelerated frame of reference could exist in all regions where a non-null (non-isotropic) vector field does not degenerate in a null (isotropic) vector field.

entry.title: Møller Energy-Momentum Complex for an Axially Symmetric Scalar Field
entry.summary: We calculate the energy-distribution for an axially symmetric scalar field in the M{\o}ller prescription. The total energy is given by the parameter m of the space-time.

author.name: I. Radinschi
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Physics, ``Gh. Asachi'' Technical University, Iasi, Romania

entry.title: Naked singularities in cylindrical collapse of counter-rotating dust shells
entry.summary: Solutions describing the gravitational collapse of asymptotically flat cylindrical and prolate shells of (null) dust are shown to admit globally naked singularities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 8 ps figures. To appear in Phys. Rev. D

entry.title: Spacetime, General Covariance, Dirac-Bergmann Observables and Non-Inertial Frames
entry.summary: Talk at the 25th Johns Hopkins Workshop "2001: A Relativistic Spacetime Odyssey", Firenze September 2001.

entry.title: The Integral Formulae for a Cylindrical Black Hole
entry.summary: Here we derive the mass formulae for a cylindrical black hole solution with positive cosmological constant and surrounded by dust. The expressions are generalising those found by Smarr for the mass and momentum of a Kerr black hole.

entry.title: Nonlinear realizations of Lorentz symmetry
entry.summary: This paper withdrawn -- it has been revised and merged with gr-qc/0205067 (Conservation laws in "Doubly Special Relativities"; Simon Judes and Matt Visser)

entry.title: A test of Einstein's theory of gravitation: Velocity distribution of low-energy particles in a spherically symmetric gravitational field
entry.summary: We propose a new test of Einstein's theory of gravitation. It concerns the velocity distribution of low-energy particles in a spherically symmetric gravitational field.

entry.title: Bianchi - Euler system for relativistice fluids and Bel - Robinson type energy
entry.summary: We write a first order symmetric hyperbolic system coupling the Riemann with the dynamical acceleration of a relativistic fluid. W determine the associated, coupled, Bel - Robinson energy, and the integral equality that it satisfies.

entry.title: Properties of the static, spherically symmetric solutions in the Jordan, Brans-Dicke theory
entry.summary: We have studied the properties of the static, spherically symmetric solution of Jordan, Brans-Dicke theory. An exact interior solution for standard space-time line element in the Schwarzschild form is obtained.

entry.title: Einstein's lifts and topologies: topological investigations on the Principle of Equivalence
entry.summary: The gedanken-experiment of Einstein's lift is analyzed in order of determining whether the free-falling observer inside the lift can detect the eventual topological non-triviality of space-time

entry.title: Problems of G and multidimensional models
entry.summary: The relations for G-dot in multidimensional model with Ricci-flat internal space and multicomponent perfect fluid are obtained. A two-component example: dust + 5-brane, is considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, Latex, subm. to Proc. of Int. Workshop in Waseda Univ

entry.title: Particle motion in electro-magnetic and gravitational pp-waves
entry.summary: We discuss the motion of neutral and charged particles in a plane electro-magnetic wave and its accompanying gravitational field.

entry.title: Time asymmetry as a consequence of the global properties of the universe
entry.summary: A global definition of time-asymmetry is presented. Schulman's two arrows of time model is criticized.

entry.title: Conformal Einstein evolution
entry.summary: We discuss various properties of the conformal field equations and their consequences for the asymptotic structure of space-times.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in: J. Frauendiener, H. Friedrich (eds.), ``The Conformal Structure of Spacetime: Geometry, Analysis, Numerics'', Springer, Lecture Notes in Physics, Berlin, 2002

entry.title: Casimir energy in multiply connected static hyperbolic Universes
entry.summary: We generalize a previously obtained result, for the case of a few other static hyperbolic universes with manifolds of nontrivial topology as spatial sections.

entry.title: Maximal acceleration or maximal accelerations?
entry.summary: We review the arguments supporting the existence of a maximal acceleration for a massive particle and show that different values of this upper limit can be predicted in different physical situations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, Latex, to be published in Int. J. Mod. Phys. D

entry.title: Supergravity Vacua Today
entry.summary: We review the definition of (maximally supersymmetric) vacuum in supergravity theories, the currently known vacua in arbitrary dimensions and how the associated supersymmetry algebras can be found. (Invited talk at the Spanish Relativity Meeting (``EREs'') 2002, Mao, Menorca, September 21-23 2002.)

entry.title: Waves in Schwarzschild spacetimes: How strong can imprints of the spacetime curvature be
entry.summary: Misprints corrected, two references added. To appear in the Phys. Rev. D.

entry.title: Near Horizon Geometry of Extreme Black Holes and Colliding Waves
entry.summary: The correspondence between black holes and colliding waves extends to cover the near horizon geometry of rotating black holes and colliding waves with cross polarization. Extreme Kerr and Kerr-Newman geometries are given as examples.

entry.title: Totally Asymmetric Torsion on Riemann-Cartan Manifold
entry.summary: A relativistic theory constructed on Riemann-Cartan manifold with a derived totally antisymmetric torsion is proposed. It follows the coincidence of the autoparallel curve and metric geodesic. The totally antisymmetric torsion naturally appears in the theory without any ad hoc imposed on.

entry.title: Non-Existence of Black Hole Solutions to Static, Spherically Symmetric Einstein-Dirac Systems - a Critical Discussion
entry.summary: This short note compares different methods to prove that Einstein-Dirac systems have no static, spherically symmetric solutions.

entry.title: Perturbations of rotating cosmological black holes
entry.summary: Charged, rotating black hole solutions of Einstein's gravitational equations are investigated in the presence of a cosmological constant. A pair of wave equations governing the electromagnetic and gravitational perturbations are derived.

entry.title: Two and Three parametric regular generalizations of spherically symmetric and axially symmetric metrics
entry.summary: Regular generalizations of spherically and axially symmetric metrics and their properties are considered. Newton gravity law generalizations are reduced for null geodesic.

author.name: N. N. Popov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Russian Academy of Sciences Computing Center

entry.title: What can we learn studying quantum black holes?
entry.summary: In this paper we try to answer the main question: what is a quantum black hole?

author.name: Victor Berezin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Inst. Nucl. Res. Russ. Acad. Sci., Moscow

entry.arxiv:comment: 65 pp.,11 Figs. To be published in Int.Journ.Mod.Phys.A as a review article

entry.title: Brane and Hot Big Bang Cosmology
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: The gauge condition in gravitation theory with a background metric
entry.summary: In gravitation theory with a background metric, a gravitational field is described by a (1,1)-tensor field. The energy-momentum conservation law imposes a gauge condition on this field.

entry.title: General Stationary, Spherically-Symmetric Solutions in the Gauge Theory of Gravity
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by the authors because it has been supplanted by gr-qc/0311007 and gr-qc/0311038.

entry.title: Spontaneous Symmetry Breaking and Higgs Field in Higher Derivative Gravity Theory
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: Spinning particles in the Perturbed Schwarzschild-de Sitter Space-Time
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: Scalar Field Solutions in Colliding Einstein-Maxwell Waves
entry.summary: A simple method is presented which enables us to construct scalar field solutions from any given Einstein-Maxwell solution in colliding plane waves. As an application we give scalar field extensions of the solution found by Hogan, Barrabes and Bressange.

entry.title: Time Variation of Photons' Velocity in a "Dark" Universe
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: The square of the Weyl tensor can be negative
entry.summary: We show that the square of the Weyl tensor can be negative by giving an example.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, latex, no figures, to appear in Gen. Relat. Grav

entry.title: Conformal Einstein equations and Cartan conformal connection
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient conditions for a space-time to be conformal to an Einstein space-time are interpreted in terms of curvature restrictions for the corresponding Cartan conformal connection.

entry.title: A field theory approach to cosmological density perturbations
entry.summary: Adiabatic perturbations propagate in the expanding universe like scalar massless fields in some effective Robertson-Walker space-time.

entry.title: Graviton and Dark Matter in a Hot Homogenous Isotropic Brane Universe: A Relativistic Theory of Gravitation Approach
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: N=2 Gauged Supergravity with Stable dS Vacuum and Masses of Ultra-Light Scalars in Einstein Field Equations
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: Quantizing the line element field
entry.summary: A metric with signature (-+++) can be constructed from a metric with signature (++++) and a double-sided vector field called the line element field. Some of the classical and quantum properties of this vector field are studied.

entry.title: The Ghost (Phantom) Universe: A Model in which the Universe is Flat, Quantum Ghost Matter and Vacuum Dominated and Accelerating
entry.summary: See hep-ph/0304045
entry.arxiv:comment: WITHDRAWN by third party submitter due to known plagiarism in hep-ph/0302267 hep-ph/0304039 hep-ph/0304040 hep-ph/0304041 hep-ph/0304042 hep-ph/0304043 hep-ph/0304044 by same author

entry.title: Reflection coefficient for superresonant scattering
entry.summary: We investigate superresonant scattering of acoustic disturbances from a rotating acoustic black hole in the low frequency range. We derive an expression for the reflection coefficient, exhibiting its frequency dependence in this regime.

entry.title: Gravitational fields and dark matter
entry.summary: In this paper a hypothesis is considered, in which neutrinos and other weakly interacting particles play a fundamental role in Universe. In addition the Newton gravitational constant $G_N$ and the Hubble constant $H$ are interpreted as parameters, characterizing the neutrinos background of Universe.

entry.title: On a wave map equation arising in general relativity
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. The paper has been accepted for publication in Communications on Pure and Applied Mathematics.

entry.title: Open static Chaplygin universe
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn by the authors
entry.arxiv:comment: this paper is withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Transformations of coordinates and Hamiltonian formalism in deformed Special Relativity
entry.summary: We investigate the transformation laws of coordinates in generalizations of special relativity with two observer-independent scales. The request of covariance leads to simple formulas if one assumes noncanonical Poisson brackets, corresponding to noncommuting spacetime coordinates.

entry.title: Multiple Photonic Shells Around a Line Singularity
entry.summary: Line singularities including cosmic strings may be screened by photonic shells until they appear as a planar wall.

entry.title: LaPlace, Weimar, Schiller and the birth of black hole theory
entry.summary: From the original papers an interesting and surprising connection is established between LaPlace and his early discovery that black holes may occur in nature, and a poem by Schiller.

entry.title: A Simple Deformation of Special Relativity
entry.summary: A deformation of special relativity based on a dispersion relation with an energy independent speed of light and a symmetry between positive and negative energy states is proposed. The deformed Lorentz transformations, generators and algebra are derived and some consequences are discussed.

entry.title: From Kaluza-Klein theory to Campbell-Magaard theorem and beyond
entry.summary: We give a brief review of recent developments in five-dimensional theories of spacetime and highlight their geometrical structure mainly in connection with the Campbell-Magaard theorem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages- To appear in "Essays in honor to Mario Novello"

entry.title: Affine Quantum Gravity
On some weak-gravitational effects
entry.summary: Some physically interesting weak-gravitational effects and phenomena are reviewed and briefly discussed: particle geometric phases due to the time-dependent spin-rotation couplings, non-inertial gravitational wave in rotating reference of frame, hyperbolical geometric quantum phases and topological dual mass as well.

entry.title: Aproximacion Discreta de la Relatividad General
entry.summary: These Lecture notes give an introduction to Regge calculus as a discrete model of General Relativity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 45 pages, 4 figures. Lecture notes on Regge calculus in Spanish

entry.title: Notes on Choptuik Phenomena
entry.summary: We review the work going on in black-hole physics during the last ten years, called the Choptuik Phenomenon.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, Plaintex, Talk given during the Research Semester on Gravitation and Cosmology, Feza Gursey Institute, Istanbul, Turkey,JUne -July 2003

entry.title: Constant mean curvature slices in the extended Schwarzschild solution and collapse of the lapse: Part I
entry.summary: We give a detailed description of the constant mean curvature foliations in the Schwarzschild solution; show that the lapse collapses exponentially, and compute the exponent.

entry.title: Constant mean curvature slices in the extended Schwarzschild solution and collapse of the lapse. Part II
entry.summary: An explicit CMC Schwarzschildean line element is derived near the critical point of the foliation, the lapse is shown to decay exponentially, and the coefficient of the exponent is calculated.

entry.title: Electron in the Einstein-Weyl space
entry.summary: The classical unified theory of Weyl is revisited. The possibility of stable extended electron model in the Einstein-Weyl space is suggested.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Relativity, Gravitation, Cosmology Nova publication

entry.title: Improved Test of General Relativity with Radio Doppler Data from the Cassini Spacecraft
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn at the recommendation of the Cassini Radio Science Team.

entry.title: Particle Creation in Anisotropically Expanding Universe
entry.summary: Using squeezed vacuum state formalism of quantum optics, an approximate solution to the semiclassical Einstein equation is obtained in Bianchi type-I universe. The phenomena of nonclassical particle creation is also examined in the anisotropic background cosmology.

entry.title: Manifold structures for sets of solutions of the general relativistic constraint equations
entry.summary: We construct manifold structures on various sets of solutions of the general relativistic initial data sets.

entry.title: Exact Cosmological Solutions of Gravitational Theories
entry.summary: A global picture is drawn tying together most exact cosmological solutions of gravitational theories in four or more spacetime dimensions.

entry.title: On the problem of cosmological singularity within gauge theories of gravitation
entry.summary: In this note I discuss the problem of cosmological singularities within gauge theories of gravitation. Solutions of cosmological equations with the scalar field are considered.

entry.title: Correct Quantization Modes of Free Fields in Schwarzschild Spacetime
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn, because the result turned out to be well known.

entry.title: Dimensional Structure of Space-Time
entry.summary: The dimensional structure of space-time is investigated according to physical and mathematical methods. We show that ther are various empirical and theoretical restrictions on the number of independent dimensions of space-time, consequently there is no physical and mathematical evidence for a space-time with four independent dimensions.

entry.title: Comments on astro-ph/0305039 and gr-qc/0309036
entry.summary: The main results of papers gr-qc/0307026 and gr-qc/0312068 are formulated. These results are opposite to conclusions of paper astro-ph/0305039 and comments gr-qc/0309036.

entry.title: Equation of Motion of Small Bodies in Relativity
entry.summary: There is proven a theorem, to the effect that a material body in general relativity, in a certain limit of sufficiently small size and mass, moves along a geodesic.

entry.title: Noether Symmetry of the Hyperextended Scalar Tensor theory for the FLRW models
entry.summary: We study in which conditions the Hyperextended Scalar Tensor theory in an FLRW background admits a Noether symmetry and derive the vectors field generating it.

entry.title: Is the Energy Density of the Cosmic Quaternionic Field a Possible Candidate for the Black Energy?
entry.summary: We try to show that the energy density of the cosmic quaternionic field might be a possible candidate for the black energy.

entry.title: Binary Neutron Star Inspiral Search in LIGO S1
entry.summary: We describe the search for gravitational waves from inspiraling neutron star binary systems, using data from the first Scientific Run of the LIGO Science Collaboration.

entry.title: Hamilton-Jacobi formalism of the massive Yang-Mills theory revisited
entry.summary: Using Hamilton-Jacobi formalism we investigated the massive Yang-Mills theory on both extended and reduced phase-space. The integrability conditions were discussed and the actions were calculated.

entry.title: Unimodular relativity and cosmological constant : Comments
entry.summary: We show that the conclusion that matter stress-energy tensor satisfies the usual covariant continuity law, and the cosmological constant is still a constant of integration arrived at by Finkelstein et al (42, 340, 2001) is not valid.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Journal of Mathematical Physics; correspondence to vns_sctiwari@yahoo.com

entry.title: Spacetime or Space and the Problem of Time
entry.summary: GR and other theories have been obtained from 3-space rather than spacetime principles. I explore consequences of this as regards the Problem of Time.
entry.arxiv:comment: For Rio de Janeiro Marcel Grossmann Proceedings

entry.title: Effective Teukolsky Equation on the Brane
entry.summary: To estimate Kaluza-Klein (KK) corrections on gravitational waves emitted by perturbed rotating black strings, we give the effective Teukolsky equation on the brane which is separable equation and hence numerically manageable.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, contribution to the Proceedings of the 6th RESCEU International Symposium, Tokyo

entry.title: Ashtekar Formulation with Temporal Foliations
entry.summary: This article has been withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: This article has been withdrawn as it is incomplete

entry.title: Quantum evolution of the Universe from $τ=0$
entry.summary: We have shown that DeWitt constraint H=0 on the physical states of the Universe does not prevent Heisenberg operators and its mean values to evolve with time. Mean value from observable, which is singular in classical theory, is also singular in a quantum case.

entry.title: Gravitational perturbation of traversable wormhole
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the perturbation problem of the scalar, electromagnetic, and gravitational waves under the traversable Lorentzian wormhole geometry. The unified form of the potential for the Schr\"odinger type one-dimensional wave equation is found.

entry.title: Rotating wormhole and scalar perturbation
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the rotational wormhole and scalar perturbation under the spacetime. We found the Schr\"odinger like equation and consider the asymptotic solutions for the special cases.

entry.title: Effects of Force and Energy in an Evolving Universe with a Gravitational Source
entry.summary: Two models are given by crossing the Friedmann metrics with Schwarzschild and Kerr metrics. In these evolving universes with a gravitational source, the force four-vector and the corresponding potentials are evaluated.

entry.title: Matter Collineations of Some Static Spherically Symmetric Spacetimes
entry.summary: We derive matter collineations for some static spherically symmetric spacetimes and compare the results with Killing, Ricci and Curvature symmetries. We conclude that matter and Ricci collineations are not, in general, the same.

entry.title: Force Behaviour in Radiation-Dominated Friedmann Universe
entry.summary: We consider radiation-dominated Friedmann universe and evaluate its force four-vector and momentum. We analyse and compare the results with the already evaluated for the matter-dominated Friedmann model. It turns out that the results are physically acceptable.

entry.title: Geometry, EFE's and Foundations for Brane Cosmology
entry.summary: I argue that GR Cauchy and Initial Value Problem mathematics is a valuable source of ideas for braneworlds based on higher-dimensional Einstein field equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, to appear in Proceedings of Rio de Janeiro 2003 Marcel Grossmann Meeting

entry.title: Canonical quantum gravity and consistent discretizations
entry.summary: This is a summary of the talk presented by JP at ICGC2004. It covered some developments in canonical quantum gravity occurred since ICGC2000, emphasizing the recently introduced consistent discretizations of general relativity.

entry.title: Wormholes in the Braneworld
entry.summary: We discuss brane wormhole solution when classical brane action contains 4d curvature. The equations of motion for the cases with R=0 and $R\ne 0$ are obtained. Their numerical solutions corresponding to wormhole are found for specific boundary conditions.

entry.title: A poor man's positive energy theorem
entry.summary: We show that positivity of energy for stationary, asymptotically flat, non-singular domains of outer communications is a simple corollary of the Lorentzian splitting theorem.

entry.title: A Note on Stress-Tensors, Conservation and Equations of Motion
entry.summary: Some unusual relations between stress tensors, conservation and equations of motion are briefly reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages. Invited contribution, A. Peres Festschrift, to be published in Found. Phys

entry.title: Newton-Cartan connections with torsion
entry.summary: We re-formulate the notion of a Newton-Cartan manifold and clarify the compatibility conditions of a connection with torsion with the Newton-Cartan structure.

entry.title: Singularities in scalar-tensor gravity
entry.summary: The analysis of certain singularities in scalar-tensor gravity contained in a recent paper is completed, and situations are pointed out in which these singularities cannot occur.

entry.title: Casimir Effect in Compact Universes
entry.summary: The Casimir effect in compact hyperbolic Universes was numerically obtained in previous publications. In this talk, I expose these results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 8 figures, Invited talk at the Theoretical Cosmology section of the Tenth Marcel Grossmann Meeting on General Relativity, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, 20-26 July, 2003

entry.title: Rotating metrics admitting non-perfect fluids in General Relativity
entry.summary: In this paper, by applying Newman-Janis algorithm in spherical symmetric metrics, a class of embedded rotating solutions of field equations is presented. These solutions admit non-perfect fluids

entry.title: Stability of Cauchy Horizon under perturbations
entry.summary: We use perturbations in order to study the stability of the Cauchy Horizon in a Reissner-Nordstr\"om space-time. The perturbations are either scalar or gravitational, and indicate some strong instabilities.

entry.title: Could the Gravitons Have Rest Masses?
Note on the luminosity distance
entry.summary: We re-derive a formula relating the areal and luminosity distances, entirely in the framework of the classical Maxwell theory, assuming a geometric-optics type condition.

entry.title: On the Riemann Extension of the Schwarzschild Metric
entry.summary: Some solutions of the Einstein equations for the eight-dimensional Riemann extension of the classical four-dimensional Schwarzschild metric are considered.

entry.title: Light Tides and the Kennedy-Thorndike experiments
entry.summary: We model the system Earth-Moon-Sun from the point of view of a frame of reference co-moving with the Earth and we derive a detailed prediction of the outcome of future Kennedy-Thorndike's type experiments to be seen as light tides.

entry.title: False vacuum decay via Coleman - de Luccia instanton in the theory with quasi-exponential potential
entry.summary: The necessary and sufficient condition for the false vacuum decay in a de Sitter universe via Coleman - de Luccia instanton is applied on the scalar field with quasi - exponential potential.

entry.title: On the variable-charged black holes in General Relativity: Hawking's radiation and naked singularities
entry.summary: In this paper we study the Hawking radiation in Reissner-Nordstrom and Kerr-Newman black holes by considering the charge to be the function of radial coordinate.

entry.title: Renormalization Group approach to Inhomogeneous Cosmology
entry.summary: Soliton solutions are recovered as scale-invariant asymptotic states of vacuum inhomogeneous cosmologies using renormalization group method. The stability analysis of these states is also given.

entry.title: ICGC-2004 Conference Overview
entry.summary: This is a written, expanded version of the summary talk given at the conclusion of the ICGC-2004 held at Cochin. Brief introductory remarks are included to provide a slightly wider context to the theme talks.

entry.title: Quasistationary collapse to the extreme Kerr black hole
entry.summary: It is shown that the extreme Kerr black hole is the only candidate for a black hole limit of rotating fluid bodies in equilibrium.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, submitted to Annalen der Physik (Leipzig)

entry.title: Modified Gravitational Theory and the Pioneer 10 and 11 Spacecraft Anomalous Acceleration
entry.summary: The nonsymmetric gravitational theory leads to a modified acceleration law that can at intermediate distance ranges account for the anomalous acceleration experienced by the Pioneer 10 and 11 spacecraft.

entry.title: Discrete symmetries and the muon's gyro-gravitational ratio in g-2 experiments
entry.summary: We show that recent, persistent discrepancies between theory and experiment can be interpreted as corrections to the gyro-gravitational ratio of the muon and lead to improved upper limits on the violation of discrete symmetries in rotational inertia.

entry.title: Comments on the kinematical structure of loop quantum cosmology
entry.summary: We comment on the presence of spurious observables and on a subtle violation of irreducibility in loop quantum cosmology.

entry.title: On a Regularity Theorem for Solutions of the Spherically Symmetric Einstein-Vlasov-Maxwell System
entry.summary: Using an estimate, we prove that if solution of the spherically symmetric Einstein-Vlasov-Maxwell system develops a singularity at all time, then the first one has to appear at the center of symmetry.

entry.title: Axi-Dilaton Gravity in D \geq 4 Dimensional Space-Times with Torsion
entry.summary: We study models of axi-dilaton gravity in space-time geometries with torsion. We discuss conformal re-scaling rules in both Riemannian and non-Riemannian formulations. We give static, spherically symmetric solutions and examine their singularity structure.

entry.title: Gravitoelectromagnetism and other decompositions of the Riemann tensor
entry.summary: We present gravitoelectromagnetism and other decompositions of the Riemann tensor from the differential-geometrical point of view.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, no figure, LaTeX, submitted for publication

entry.title: Spacetime topology from causality
entry.summary: We prove that a globally hyperbolic spacetime with its causality relation is a bicontinuous poset whose interval topology is the manifold topology. This provides an abstract mathematical setting in which one can study causality independent of geometry and differentiable structure.

entry.title: The asymptotic conformal invariance in Chern-Simons theory with matter in curved space-time
entry.summary: We consider the asymptoic behaviour of the Chern - Simons (CS) theory with matter in curved space - time. The asymptotics of effective couplings are discussed.

entry.title: On the counting of black hole states in loop quantum gravity
entry.summary: We argue that counting black hole states in loop quantum gravity one should take into account only states with the minimal spin at the horizon.

entry.title: An interior solution of constant density to Gurses metric
entry.summary: We give here an interior metric which matches Gurses metric. The metric given here is a sphere of electrically counterpoised dust (ECD) of constant density. We use Lane Emden equation for obtaining the interior solution.

entry.title: Freely falling observers
entry.summary: We show that the field equations of the Schwarzschild geometry are invariant under passive Lorentz transformations to a freely falling system. We decompose the field equations with respect to the accelerated system and find that the force of gravity is not transformed away but dynamically compensated.

entry.title: A note on the non-existence of $σ$-model solitons in the 2+1 dimensional AdS gravity
entry.summary: We show that the gravitating static soliton in the 2+1 dimensional O(3) $\sigma$ model does not exist in the presence of a negative cosmological constant.

entry.title: A Coherent Strategy for Qauntum Gravity
entry.summary: Affine quantum gravity, which differs notably from either string theory or loop quantum gravity, is briefly reviewed. Emphasis in this article is placed on the use of affine coherent states in this program.

entry.title: Elliptic systems
entry.summary: In this article I will review some basic results on elliptic boundary value problems with applications to General Relativity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, latex, uses svmult.cls style file (included). To appear in the Proceeding of the March-2004 Heraeus Seminar in Bad Honnef

entry.title: Holographic bound and spectrum of quantized black hole
entry.summary: Recent attempts to calculate the black-hole entropy in loop quantum gravity are demonstrated to be erroneous. The correct solution of the problem is pointed out.

entry.title: No news for Kerr-Schild fields
entry.summary: Algebraically special fields with no gravitational radiation are described. Kerr-Schild fields, which include as a concrete case the Kinnersley photon rocket, form an important subclass of them.

entry.title: Introduction to cosmology
entry.summary: This text consists on a series of introductory lectures on cosmology for mathematicians and physicists who are not specialized on the subject.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex file, 42 pages. Lectures given at the "Ecole Internationale sur les structures geometriques et applications", Dakar, Senegal, november 2004. In French

entry.title: Dynamics of a Spherical Null Shell within the Distributional Formalism
entry.summary: Dynamics of a null thin shell immersed in a generic spherically symmetric spacetime is obtained within the distributional formalism. It has been shown that the distributional formalism leads to the same result as in the conventional formalism.

entry.title: On the history of fourth order metric theories of gravitation
entry.summary: We present the history of fourth order metric theories of gravitation from its beginning in 1918 until 1988.

entry.title: Modified Friedman scenario from the Wheeler-DeWitt equation
entry.summary: We consider the possible modification of the Friedman equation due to operator ordering parameter entering the Wheeler-DeWitt equation.

entry.title: Interacting with the fifth dimension
entry.summary: Some new five dimensional minimal scalar-Einstein exact solutions are presented. These new solutions are tested against various criteria used to measure interaction with the fifth dimension.

entry.title: Black holes: a prediction of theory or phantasy?
entry.summary: We argue for black holes do not represent a strict consequence of general relativity.

entry.title: Newtonian limit of Extended Theories of Gravity
entry.summary: Newtonian limit of Extended Theories of Gravity (in particular, higher--order and scalar--tensor theories) is theoretically discussed taking into account recent observational and experimental results.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: to appera in Progress in General Relativity and Quantum Cosmology, Nova Science Eds. 2004

entry.title: Rotating embedded black holes: Entropy and Hawking's radiation
entry.summary: In this paper we derive a class of rotating embedded black holes. Then we study Hawking's radiation effects on these embedded black holes. The surface gravity, entropy and angular velocity are given for each of these black holes.

entry.title: What kind of noncommutative geometry for quantum gravity ?
entry.summary: We give a brief account of the description of the standard model in noncommutative geometry as well as the thermal time hypothesis, questioning their relevance for quantum gravity.

entry.title: Future complete spacetimes with spacelike isometry group and field sources
entry.summary: We extend to the Einstein Maxwell Higgs system results first obtained previously in collaboration with V. Moncrief for Einstein equations in vacuum.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in proceedings of the greek relativity meeting 2004

entry.title: Exact solutions of the Dirac equation in Robertson-Walker space-time
entry.summary: The covariant Dirac equation in Robertson-Walker space-time is studied under the comoving coordinates. The exact forms of the spatial factor of wave function are respectively acquired in closed, spatially flat, and open universes.

entry.title: Analog of Superradiance effect in BEC
entry.summary: We investigate the scattering of phase oscillation of Bose-Einstein Condensate by a 'draining of bathtub' type fluid motion. We derive a relation between the reflection and transmission coefficients which exhibits existence of analog of 'Superradiance effect' in BEC vortex with sink.

entry.title: Radiating Levi-Civita Spacetime
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, See J.Krishna Rao, J. Phys. A: Gen. Phys., 4, 17 (1971) for radiating Levi-Civita metric.

entry.title: A Mass Dependent String-Quintessence Model at the Planck Scale
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by arXiv admin due to authors' misrepresentation of identity/affiliation.

entry.title: Particle scattering in loop quantum gravity
entry.summary: We devise a technique for defining and computing n-point functions in the context of a background-independent gravitational quantum field theory. We construct a tentative implementation of this technique in a perturbatively-finite loop/spinfoam model.

entry.title: On the gravitational field induced by static electromagnetic sources
entry.summary: It is argued that static electromagnetic sources induce Weyl-Majumdar-Papapetrou solutions for the spacetime metric. The acceleration in such fields has a term many orders of magnitude stronger than usual perturbative terms. Two electrostatic and two magnetostatic examples are given.

entry.title: Energy Transport in the Vaidya System
entry.summary: Energy transport mechanisms can be generated by imposing relations between null tetrad Ricci components. Several kinds of mass and density transport generated by these relations are studied for the generalized Vaidya system.

entry.title: $\mathcal{N}=1$ SUGRA Noether Charges
entry.summary: In this work a generic set of boundary conditions for $\mathcal{N}=1$ SUGRA is proposed. This conditions defines that Hamiltonian charges equals Noether ones, including supercharge.

entry.title: Induced Matter Theory & Heisenberg-like Uncertainty Relations
entry.summary: We show that a differential variant of the Heisenberg uncertainty relations emerges naturally from induced matter theory, as a sum of line elements in both momentum and Minkowski spaces.

entry.title: An Issue to the Cosmological Constant Problem
entry.summary: According to general relativity, the present analysis shows on geometrical grounds that the cosmological constant problem is an artifact due to the unfounded link of this fundamental constant to vacuum energy density of quantum fluctuations.

entry.title: New vacuum Robinson--Trautman metrics
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. The metrics presented are known since 1969 (and are referred to as C-metrics)

entry.title: Dust-shell Universe in the modified gravity scenario
entry.summary: The dynamics of the dust-shell model of universe is exactly solved for the modified Schwarzschild solution. This solution is used to derive the cosmology corresponding to the modified gravity.

entry.title: Energy and Hamiltonian in first order gravity
entry.summary: In this work the definition of a quasilocal energy for four dimensional first order gravity is developed. Using this an action principle which is adequate for the canonical ensemble is obtained. The microcanonical action principle is obtained as well.

entry.title: The Topology of Branching Universes
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to survey the possible topologies of branching space-times, and, in particular, to refute the popular notion in the literature that a branching space-time requires a non-Hausdorff topology.

entry.title: Birkhoff for Lovelock Redux
entry.summary: We show succinctly that all metric theories with second order field equations obey Birkhoff's theorem: their spherically symmetric solutions are static.

entry.title: Creation of Photons in Anisotropic Space-Times
entry.summary: This paper has been removed by arXiv administrators because of excessive overlap with gr-qc/0506062.
entry.arxiv:comment: withdrawn by arXiv administrators due to excessive overlap. See http://arxiv.org/new/withdrawals.aug.07.html

entry.title: Higher Dimensional Generalizations of the Kerr Black Hole
entry.summary: A brief introduction is given to rotating black holes in more than four spacetime dimensions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, to appear in "Kerr Spacetime: Rotating Black Holes", eds. S. Scott, M. Visser, and D. Wiltshire (Cambridge University Press)

entry.title: Weyl electrovacuum solutions and gauge invariance
entry.summary: It is argued that in Weyl electrovacuum solutions the linear term in the metric cannot be eliminated just on grounds of gauge invariance. Its importance is stressed.

entry.title: Overview of Affine Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: The basic principles of Affine Quantum Gravity are presented in a pedagogical style with a limited number of equations.

entry.title: Black Hole Statistical Physics: Entropy
entry.summary: We discuss the most interesting approaches to derivation of the Bekenstein-Hawking entropy formula from a statistical theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk presented at Workshop on High Energy Physics&Field Theory (Protvino, Russia, 2004)

entry.title: Cosmic Neutrinos and Quantum Gravity with Extra Dimensions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors because the authors excluded the paper from electronic proceedings of the conference.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Plenary talk presented at Workshop on High Energy Physics&Field Theory (Protvino, Russia, 2004)
entry.summary: The problems concerning a possible discovery of the mini block holes at earthly accelerators are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk presented at Workshop on High Energy Physics&Field Theory (Protvino, Russia, 2004)

entry.title: Observables for the polarized Gowdy model
entry.summary: We give an explicit characterization of all functions on the phase space for the polarized Gowdy 3-torus spacetimes which have weakly vanishing Poisson brackets with the Hamiltonian and momentum constraint functions.

entry.title: Space-times produced by a time-dependent scalar field
entry.summary: Models of Lorentz/diffeomorphism violation frequently make use of a time-dependent scalar field. We investigate space-times produced by such a field.

entry.title: The Momentum 4-Vector of Static Bianchi-type Space-times in Tele-parallel Gravity
entry.summary: This paper has excessive overlap with the following paper also written by the authors or their collaborators: gr-qc/0511095.
entry.arxiv:comment: withdrawn by arXiv administrators due to overlap. See http://arxiv.org/new/withdrawals.aug.07.html

entry.title: Worldline deviations of charged spinning particles
entry.summary: The geodesic deviation equation is generalized to worldline deviation equations describing the relative accelerations of charged spinning particles in the framework of Dixon-Souriau equations of motion.

entry.title: Newtonian Gravitomagnetism and analysis of Earth Satellite Results
entry.summary: The possibility of a Newtonian gravitomagnetic field is considered here with its immediate and far-reaching implications for the interpretation of 2004 LAGEOS experimental results confirming the general relativistic prediction of Lense-Thirring effect.

entry.title: Creation of Massless Spin-1 Particles in a Godel-type Metric
entry.summary: This paper has inappropriate amounts of overlap with the following papers also written by the authors or their collaborators: gr-qc/0502059, gr-qc/0502061, gr-qc/0207026, and others.

entry.title: The need for dark matter in galaxies
entry.summary: Cooperstock and Tieu have proposed a model to account for galactic rotation curves without invoking dark matter. I argue that no model of this type can work.

entry.title: Angular momentum-mass inequality for axisymmetric black holes
entry.summary: The inequality $\sqrt{J}\leq m$ is proved for vacuum, asymptotically flat, maximal and axisymmetric data close to extreme Kerr data. The physical significance of this inequality and its relation to the standard picture of the gravitational collapse are discussed.

entry.title: Clifford bundle formulation of BF gravity generalized to the standard model
entry.summary: The structure and dynamics of the standard model and gravity are described by a Clifford valued connection and its curvature.

entry.title: Exact Vacuum Solutions of Jordan, Brans-Dicke Field Equations
entry.summary: We present the static spherically symmetric vacuum solutions of the Jordan, Brans-Dicke field equations. The new solutions are obtained by considering a polar Gaussian, isothermal and radial hyperbolic metrics.

entry.title: On the algebraic classification of spacetimes
entry.summary: We briefly overview the Petrov classification in four dimensions and its generalization to higher dimensions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Journal of Physics, conference series, proceedings of 4th meeting on constrained dynamics and quantum gravity, 12-16 September 2005, Sardinia, Italy

entry.title: Dynamics and Thermodynamics of Blackholes and Naked Singularities
entry.summary: Proceedings of the international Workshop on ``Dynamics and Thermodynamics of Blackholes and Naked Singularities``, that took place at the Department of Mathematics of the Politecnico of Milano from 13 to 15 May 2004.

entry.title: A note on static metrics
entry.summary: Conditions are given which, subject to a genericity condition on the Ricci tensor, are both necessary and sufficient for a 3-metric to arise from a static spacetime metric.

entry.title: Multidimensional global monopole in presence of Electromagnetic Field
entry.summary: We study the gravitational properties of a global monopole in $(D = d + 2)$ dimensional space-time in presence of electromagnetic field.

entry.title: On Israel-Wilson-Perjes black holes
entry.summary: We show, under certain conditions, that regular Israel-Wilson-Perj\'es black holes necessarily belong to the Majumdar-Papapetrou family.

entry.title: Cylindrically Symmetric-Static Brans-Dicke-Maxwell Solutions
entry.summary: We present static cylindrically symmetric electrovac solutions in the framework of the Brans-Dicke theory and show that our solution yields some of the well-known solutions for special values of the parameters of the resulting metric functions.

entry.title: Geometric Analysis and General Relativity
entry.summary: This article discusses methods of geometric analysis in general relativity, with special focus on the role of "critical surfaces" such as minimal surfaces, marginal surface, maximal surfaces and null surfaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Elsevier Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, 2006

entry.title: Remarks on the WDW equation
entry.summary: We show a kind of converse to some results of Hall and Reginatto on exact uncertainty related to the Schroedinger and Wheeler-deWitt equations. Some survey material on statistical geometrodynamics is also sketched.

entry.title: Four-dimensional Einstein spaces on Six-dimensional Ricci-flat base space
entry.summary: The examples of ten-dimensional vacuum Einstein spaces composed of four-dimensional Einstein spaces and six-dimensional Ricci-flat base space defined by the solutions of the Korteveg de-Vries equation are constructed.

entry.title: Wave Mechanics and General Relativity: A Rapprochement
entry.summary: Using exact solutions, we show that it is in principle possible to regard waves and particles as representations of the same underlying geometry, thereby resolving the problem of wave-particle duality.

entry.title: Embedding of the Kerr-Newman Black Hole Surface in Euclidean Space
entry.summary: We obtain a global embedding of the surface of a rapidly rotating Kerr-Newman black hole in an Euclidean 4-dimensional space.

entry.title: The Cauchy Problem for the Wave Equation in the Schwarzschild Geometry
entry.summary: The Cauchy problem is considered for the scalar wave equation in the Schwarzschild geometry. We derive an integral spectral representation for the solution and prove pointwise decay in time.

entry.title: Testing existence of antigravity
entry.summary: After a brief review of arguments in favor of antigravity (as gravitational repulsion between matter and antimatter) we present a simple idea for an experimental test using antiprotons. Different experimental realizations of the same basic idea are considered

entry.title: Higher dimensional global monopole with cosmological term
entry.summary: We investigate the space-time of a global monopole in a five dimensional space-time in presence of the cosmological term. Also the gravitational properties of the monopole solution are discussed.

entry.title: Gravitational waves and fundamental physics
entry.summary: I give an overview of the motivations for gravitational-wave research, concentrating on the aspects related to ``fundamental'' physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 2 figures, to appear in "Sense of Beauty in Physics", a Volume in honour of the 70th birthday of Adriano Di Giacomo

entry.title: Some bounds extracted from a quantum of area
entry.summary: Asking very elementary relativistic quantum mechanics to meet quantums of area and time, it is possible to observe at a general level: a) the seesaw bound for the mass of neutrinos, and b) the need of a gauge group at energies below Planck mass.

entry.title: Gravity on the octonion algebra
entry.summary: Gravitational interactions are treated as non-associative part of a Lagrangian of octonion fields. The Lagrangian is defined in the charge space as squared curvature with respect to the octonion fields. The applications of suggested formalism to homogeneous and isotropic space are studied.

entry.title: Gravitational Constant and Torsion
entry.summary: Riemann-Cartan space time $U_{4}$ is considered here. It has been shown that when we link topological Nieh-Yan density with the gravitational constant then we get Einstein-Hilbert Lagrangian as a consequence.

entry.title: Unfinished revolution
entry.summary: Introductive chapter of a book on Quantum Gravity, edited by Daniele Oriti, to appear with Cambridge University Press.

entry.title: The quantum black hole in 2+1 dimensions
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the quantum nature of a 2+1 dimensional black hole using the method [arXiv: gr-qc/0504030] which earlier revealed the quantum nature of a black hole in 3+1 dimensions.

entry.title: Weak Values and Relational Generalisations
entry.summary: We justify generalisations of weak values from a tentatively relational perspective by deriving them from a generalisation of Bayes' rule. We also argue that these generalisations have implications of quantum nonlocality and may form a novel approach to quantum gravity and cosmology.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, contains a reworking of an argument in gr-qc/0603015

entry.title: A Toy Model for Black Hole in Noncommutative Spaces
entry.summary: We present a new point of view on the problem of the Schwarzschild black hole in the noncommutative spaces, proposed recently by F. Nasseri. We apply our treatment also to the case of the 2+1 dimensional Ba\~ nados-Teitelboim-Zanelli black hole.

entry.title: Gravitons in Kaluza-Klein Theory
entry.summary: This is a pedagogical introduction to original Kaluza-Klein theory and its salient features. Most of the technical calculations are given in detail and the nature of gravitons is discussed.

entry.title: On Quantization of the Electrical Charge--Mass
entry.summary: Suggested a non-linear, non-gauge invariant model of Maxwell equations, based on the Kaluza-Klein theory. The spectrum of elementary charges and masses is obtained.

entry.title: Explicit Constructions of the Fedosov star on some Lorentzian Space-Times
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to the fact that the results were found to be done previously.

entry.title: Quantum Modified Null Trajectories in Schwarzschild Spacetime
entry.summary: The photon vacuum polarization effect in curved spacetime leads to birefringence, i.e. the photon velocity becomes greater than (or less than) the speed of light depending on its polarization. We investigate this phenomenon in a Schwarzschild curved spacetime.
